94 static my_bool mysql_client_init= 0;
95 static my_bool org_my_init_done= 0;
96 
97 
98 /*
99  Initialize the MySQL client library
100 
101  SYNOPSIS
102  mysql_server_init()
103 
104  NOTES
105  Should be called before doing any other calls to the MySQL
106  client library to initialize thread specific variables etc.
107  It's called by mysql_init() to ensure that things will work for
108  old not threaded applications that doesn't call mysql_server_init()
109  directly.
110 
111  RETURN
112  0 ok
113  1 could not initialize environment (out of memory or thread keys)
114 */
115 
116 int STDCALL mysql_server_init(int argc __attribute__((unused)),
117  char **argv __attribute__((unused)),
118  char **groups __attribute__((unused)))
119 {
120  int result= 0;
121  if (!mysql_client_init)
122  {
123  mysql_client_init=1;
124  org_my_init_done=my_init_done;
125  if (my_init()) /* Will init threads */
126  return 1;
127  init_client_errs();
128  if (mysql_client_plugin_init())
129  return 1;
130  if (!mysql_port)
131  {
132  char *env;
133  struct servent *serv_ptr __attribute__((unused));
134 
135  mysql_port = MYSQL_PORT;
136 
137  /*
138  if builder specifically requested a default port, use that
139  (even if it coincides with our factory default).
140  only if they didn't do we check /etc/services (and, failing
141  on that, fall back to the factory default of 3306).
142  either default can be overridden by the environment variable
143  MYSQL_TCP_PORT, which in turn can be overridden with command
144  line options.
145  */
146 
147 #if MYSQL_PORT_DEFAULT == 0
148  if ((serv_ptr= getservbyname("mysql", "tcp")))
149  mysql_port= (uint) ntohs((ushort) serv_ptr->s_port);
150 #endif
151  if ((env= getenv("MYSQL_TCP_PORT")))
152  mysql_port=(uint) atoi(env);
153  }
154 
155  if (!mysql_unix_port)
156  {
157  char *env;
158 #ifdef __WIN__
159  mysql_unix_port = (char*) MYSQL_NAMEDPIPE;
160 #else
161  mysql_unix_port = (char*) MYSQL_UNIX_ADDR;
162 #endif
163  if ((env = getenv("MYSQL_UNIX_PORT")))
164  mysql_unix_port = env;
165  }
166  mysql_debug(NullS);
167 #if defined(SIGPIPE) && !defined(__WIN__)
168  (void) signal(SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);
169 #endif
170 #ifdef EMBEDDED_LIBRARY
171  if (argc > -1)
172  result= init_embedded_server(argc, argv, groups);
173 #endif
174  }
175  else
176  result= (int)my_thread_init(); /* Init if new thread */
177  return result;
178 }
179 
180 
181 /*
182  Free all memory and resources used by the client library
183 
184  NOTES
185  When calling this there should not be any other threads using
186  the library.
187 
188  To make things simpler when used with windows dll's (which calls this
189  function automaticly), it's safe to call this function multiple times.
190 */
191 
192 
193 void STDCALL mysql_server_end()
194 {
195  if (!mysql_client_init)
196  return;
197 
198  mysql_client_plugin_deinit();
199 
200 #ifdef EMBEDDED_LIBRARY
201  end_embedded_server();
202 #endif
203  finish_client_errs();
204  vio_end();
205 
206  /* If library called my_init(), free memory allocated by it */
207  if (!org_my_init_done)
208  {
209  my_end(0);
210  }
211  else
212  {
213  free_charsets();
214  mysql_thread_end();
215  }
216 
217  mysql_client_init= org_my_init_done= 0;
218 }

239 /*
240  Expand wildcard to a sql string
241 */
242 
243 static void
244 append_wild(char *to, char *end, const char *wild)
245 {
246  end-=5; /* Some extra */
247  if (wild && wild[0])
248  {
249  to=strmov(to," like '");
250  while (*wild && to < end)
251  {
252  if (*wild == '\\' || *wild == '\'')
253  *to++='\\';
254  *to++= *wild++;
255  }
256  if (*wild) /* Too small buffer */
257  *to++='%'; /* Nicer this way */
258  to[0]='\'';
259  to[1]=0;
260  }
261 }

264 /**************************************************************************
265  Init debugging if MYSQL_DEBUG environment variable is found
266 **************************************************************************/
267 
268 void STDCALL
269 mysql_debug(const char *debug __attribute__((unused)))
270 {
271 #ifndef DBUG_OFF
272  char *env;
273  if (debug)
274  {
275  DBUG_PUSH(debug);
276  }
277  else if ((env = getenv("MYSQL_DEBUG")))
278  {
279  DBUG_PUSH(env);
280 #if !defined(_WINVER) && !defined(WINVER)
281  puts("\n-------------------------------------------------------");
282  puts("MYSQL_DEBUG found. libmysql started with the following:");
283  puts(env);
284  puts("-------------------------------------------------------\n");
285 #else
286  {
287  char buff[80];
288  buff[sizeof(buff)-1]= 0;
289  strxnmov(buff,sizeof(buff)-1,"libmysql: ", env, NullS);
290  MessageBox((HWND) 0,"Debugging variable MYSQL_DEBUG used",buff,MB_OK);
291  }
292 #endif
293  }
294 #endif
295 }

319 MYSQL * STDCALL
320 mysql_connect(MYSQL *mysql,const char *host,
321  const char *user, const char *passwd)
322 {
323  MYSQL *res;
324  mysql=mysql_init(mysql); /* Make it thread safe */
325  {
326  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_connect");
327  if (!(res=mysql_real_connect(mysql,host,user,passwd,NullS,0,NullS,0)))
328  {
329  if (mysql->free_me)
330  my_free(mysql);
331  }
332  mysql->reconnect= 1;
333  DBUG_RETURN(res);
334  }
335 }

339 /**************************************************************************
340  Change user and database
341 **************************************************************************/
342 
343 my_bool STDCALL mysql_change_user(MYSQL *mysql, const char *user,
344  const char *passwd, const char *db)
345 {
346  int rc;
347  CHARSET_INFO *saved_cs= mysql->charset;
348  char *saved_user= mysql->user;
349  char *saved_passwd= mysql->passwd;
350  char *saved_db= mysql->db;
351 
352  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_change_user");
353 
354  /* Get the connection-default character set. */
355 
356  if (mysql_init_character_set(mysql))
357  {
358  mysql->charset= saved_cs;
359  DBUG_RETURN(TRUE);
360  }
361 
362  /* Use an empty string instead of NULL. */
363 
364  mysql->user= (char*)(user ? user : "");
365  mysql->passwd= (char*)(passwd ? passwd : "");
366  mysql->db= 0;
367 
368  rc= run_plugin_auth(mysql, 0, 0, 0, db);
369 
370  /*
371  The server will close all statements no matter was the attempt
372  to change user successful or not.
373  */
374  mysql_detach_stmt_list(&mysql->stmts, "mysql_change_user");
375  if (rc == 0)
376  {
377  /* Free old connect information */
378  my_free(saved_user);
379  my_free(saved_passwd);
380  my_free(saved_db);
381 
382  /* alloc new connect information */
383  mysql->user= my_strdup(mysql->user, MYF(MY_WME));
384  mysql->passwd= my_strdup(mysql->passwd, MYF(MY_WME));
385  mysql->db= db ? my_strdup(db, MYF(MY_WME)) : 0;
386  }
387  else
388  {
389  mysql->charset= saved_cs;
390  mysql->user= saved_user;
391  mysql->passwd= saved_passwd;
392  mysql->db= saved_db;
393  }
394 
395  DBUG_RETURN(rc);
396 }

403 #if !defined(__WIN__)
404 
405 void read_user_name(char *name)
406 {
407  DBUG_ENTER("read_user_name");
408  if (geteuid() == 0)
409  (void) strmov(name,"root"); /* allow use of surun */
410  else
411  {
412 #ifdef HAVE_GETPWUID
413  struct passwd *skr;
414  const char *str;
415  if ((str=getlogin()) == NULL)
416  {
417  if ((skr=getpwuid(geteuid())) != NULL)
418  str=skr->pw_name;
419  else if (!(str=getenv("USER")) && !(str=getenv("LOGNAME")) &&
420  !(str=getenv("LOGIN")))
421  str="UNKNOWN_USER";
422  }
423  (void) strmake(name,str,USERNAME_LENGTH);
424 #elif HAVE_CUSERID
425  (void) cuserid(name);
426 #else
427  strmov(name,"UNKNOWN_USER");
428 #endif
429  }
430  DBUG_VOID_RETURN;
431 }
432 
433 #else /* If Windows */
434 
435 void read_user_name(char *name)
436 {
437  char *str=getenv("USER"); /* ODBC will send user variable */
438  strmake(name,str ? str : "ODBC", USERNAME_LENGTH);
439 }

441 #endif

443 my_bool handle_local_infile(MYSQL *mysql, const char *net_filename)
444 {
445  my_bool result= 1;
446  uint packet_length=MY_ALIGN(mysql->net.max_packet-16,IO_SIZE);
447  NET *net= &mysql->net;
448  int readcount;
449  void *li_ptr; /* pass state to local_infile functions */
450  char *buf; /* buffer to be filled by local_infile_read */
451  struct st_mysql_options *options= &mysql->options;
452  DBUG_ENTER("handle_local_infile");
453 
454  /* check that we've got valid callback functions */
455  if (!(options->local_infile_init &&
456  options->local_infile_read &&
457  options->local_infile_end &&
458  options->local_infile_error))
459  {
460  /* if any of the functions is invalid, set the default */
461  mysql_set_local_infile_default(mysql);
462  }
463 
464  /* copy filename into local memory and allocate read buffer */
465  if (!(buf=my_malloc(packet_length, MYF(0))))
466  {
467  set_mysql_error(mysql, CR_OUT_OF_MEMORY, unknown_sqlstate);
468  DBUG_RETURN(1);
469  }
470 
471  /* initialize local infile (open file, usually) */
472  if ((*options->local_infile_init)(&li_ptr, net_filename,
473  options->local_infile_userdata))
474  {
475  (void) my_net_write(net,(const uchar*) "",0); /* Server needs one packet */
476  net_flush(net);
477  strmov(net->sqlstate, unknown_sqlstate);
478  net->last_errno=
479  (*options->local_infile_error)(li_ptr,
480  net->last_error,
481  sizeof(net->last_error)-1);
482  goto err;
483  }
484 
485  /* read blocks of data from local infile callback */
486  while ((readcount =
487  (*options->local_infile_read)(li_ptr, buf,
488  packet_length)) > 0)
489  {
490  if (my_net_write(net, (uchar*) buf, readcount))
491  {
492  DBUG_PRINT("error",
493  ("Lost connection to MySQL server during LOAD DATA of local file"));
494  set_mysql_error(mysql, CR_SERVER_LOST, unknown_sqlstate);
495  goto err;
496  }
497  }
498 
499  /* Send empty packet to mark end of file */
500  if (my_net_write(net, (const uchar*) "", 0) || net_flush(net))
501  {
502  set_mysql_error(mysql, CR_SERVER_LOST, unknown_sqlstate);
503  goto err;
504  }
505 
506  if (readcount < 0)
507  {
508  net->last_errno=
509  (*options->local_infile_error)(li_ptr,
510  net->last_error,
511  sizeof(net->last_error)-1);
512  goto err;
513  }
514 
515  result=0; /* Ok */
516 
517 err:
518  /* free up memory allocated with _init, usually */
519  (*options->local_infile_end)(li_ptr);
520  my_free(buf);
521  DBUG_RETURN(result);
522 }

525 /****************************************************************************
526  Default handlers for LOAD LOCAL INFILE
527 ****************************************************************************/
528 
529 typedef struct st_default_local_infile
530 {
531  int fd;
532  int error_num;
533  const char *filename;
534  char error_msg[LOCAL_INFILE_ERROR_LEN];
535 } default_local_infile_data;
536 
537 
538 /*
539  Open file for LOAD LOCAL INFILE
540 
541  SYNOPSIS
542  default_local_infile_init()
543  ptr Store pointer to internal data here
544  filename File name to open. This may be in unix format !
545 
546 
547  NOTES
548  Even if this function returns an error, the load data interface
549  guarantees that default_local_infile_end() is called.
550 
551  RETURN
552  0 ok
553  1 error
554 */
555 
556 static int default_local_infile_init(void **ptr, const char *filename,
557  void *userdata __attribute__ ((unused)))
558 {
559  default_local_infile_data *data;
560  char tmp_name[FN_REFLEN];
561 
562  if (!(*ptr= data= ((default_local_infile_data *)
563  my_malloc(sizeof(default_local_infile_data), MYF(0)))))
564  return 1; /* out of memory */
565 
566  data->error_msg[0]= 0;
567  data->error_num= 0;
568  data->filename= filename;
569 
570  fn_format(tmp_name, filename, "", "", MY_UNPACK_FILENAME);
571  if ((data->fd = my_open(tmp_name, O_RDONLY, MYF(0))) < 0)
572  {
573  data->error_num= my_errno;
574  my_snprintf(data->error_msg, sizeof(data->error_msg)-1,
575  EE(EE_FILENOTFOUND), tmp_name, data->error_num);
576  return 1;
577  }
578  return 0; /* ok */
579 }
580 
581 
582 /*
583  Read data for LOAD LOCAL INFILE
584 
585  SYNOPSIS
586  default_local_infile_read()
587  ptr Points to handle allocated by _init
588  buf Read data here
589  buf_len Ammount of data to read
590 
591  RETURN
592  > 0 number of bytes read
593  == 0 End of data
594  < 0 Error
595 */
596 
597 static int default_local_infile_read(void *ptr, char *buf, uint buf_len)
598 {
599  int count;
600  default_local_infile_data*data = (default_local_infile_data *) ptr;
601 
602  if ((count= (int) my_read(data->fd, (uchar *) buf, buf_len, MYF(0))) < 0)
603  {
604  data->error_num= EE_READ; /* the errmsg for not entire file read */
605  my_snprintf(data->error_msg, sizeof(data->error_msg)-1,
606  EE(EE_READ),
607  data->filename, my_errno);
608  }
609  return count;
610 }
611 
612 
613 /*
614  Read data for LOAD LOCAL INFILE
615 
616  SYNOPSIS
617  default_local_infile_end()
618  ptr Points to handle allocated by _init
619  May be NULL if _init failed!
620 
621  RETURN
622 */
623 
624 static void default_local_infile_end(void *ptr)
625 {
626  default_local_infile_data *data= (default_local_infile_data *) ptr;
627  if (data) /* If not error on open */
628  {
629  if (data->fd >= 0)
630  my_close(data->fd, MYF(MY_WME));
631  my_free(ptr);
632  }
633 }
634 
635 
636 /*
637  Return error from LOAD LOCAL INFILE
638 
639  SYNOPSIS
640  default_local_infile_end()
641  ptr Points to handle allocated by _init
642  May be NULL if _init failed!
643  error_msg Store error text here
644  error_msg_len Max lenght of error_msg
645 
646  RETURN
647  error message number
648 */
649 
650 static int
651 default_local_infile_error(void *ptr, char *error_msg, uint error_msg_len)
652 {
653  default_local_infile_data *data = (default_local_infile_data *) ptr;
654  if (data) /* If not error on open */
655  {
656  strmake(error_msg, data->error_msg, error_msg_len);
657  return data->error_num;
658  }
659  /* This can only happen if we got error on malloc of handle */
660  strmov(error_msg, ER(CR_OUT_OF_MEMORY));
661  return CR_OUT_OF_MEMORY;
662 }
663 
664 
665 void
666 mysql_set_local_infile_handler(MYSQL *mysql,
667  int (*local_infile_init)(void **, const char *,
668  void *),
669  int (*local_infile_read)(void *, char *, uint),
670  void (*local_infile_end)(void *),
671  int (*local_infile_error)(void *, char *, uint),
672  void *userdata)
673 {
674  mysql->options.local_infile_init= local_infile_init;
675  mysql->options.local_infile_read= local_infile_read;
676  mysql->options.local_infile_end= local_infile_end;
677  mysql->options.local_infile_error= local_infile_error;
678  mysql->options.local_infile_userdata = userdata;
679 }
680 
681 
682 void mysql_set_local_infile_default(MYSQL *mysql)
683 {
684  mysql->options.local_infile_init= default_local_infile_init;
685  mysql->options.local_infile_read= default_local_infile_read;
686  mysql->options.local_infile_end= default_local_infile_end;
687  mysql->options.local_infile_error= default_local_infile_error;
688 }

694 **************************************************************************/

696 int STDCALL

700 }

703 /**************************************************************************
704  Return next field of the query results
705 **************************************************************************/
706 
707 MYSQL_FIELD * STDCALL
708 mysql_fetch_field(MYSQL_RES *result)
709 {
710  if (result->current_field >= result->field_count)
711  return(NULL);
712  return &result->fields[result->current_field++];
713 }

716 /**************************************************************************
717  Move to a specific row and column
718 **************************************************************************/
719 
720 void STDCALL
721 mysql_data_seek(MYSQL_RES *result, my_ulonglong row)
722 {
723  MYSQL_ROWS *tmp=0;
724  DBUG_PRINT("info",("mysql_data_seek(%ld)",(long) row));
725  if (result->data)
726  for (tmp=result->data->data; row-- && tmp ; tmp = tmp->next) ;
727  result->current_row=0;
728  result->data_cursor = tmp;
729 }
730 
731 
732 /*************************************************************************
733  put the row or field cursor one a position one got from mysql_row_tell()
734  This doesn't restore any data. The next mysql_fetch_row or
735  mysql_fetch_field will return the next row or field after the last used
736 *************************************************************************/
737 
738 MYSQL_ROW_OFFSET STDCALL
739 mysql_row_seek(MYSQL_RES *result, MYSQL_ROW_OFFSET row)
740 {
741  MYSQL_ROW_OFFSET return_value=result->data_cursor;
742  result->current_row= 0;
743  result->data_cursor= row;
744  return return_value;
745 }
746 
747 
748 MYSQL_FIELD_OFFSET STDCALL
749 mysql_field_seek(MYSQL_RES *result, MYSQL_FIELD_OFFSET field_offset)
750 {
751  MYSQL_FIELD_OFFSET return_value=result->current_field;
752  result->current_field=field_offset;
753  return return_value;
754 }

757 /*****************************************************************************
758  List all databases
759 *****************************************************************************/
760 
761 MYSQL_RES * STDCALL
762 mysql_list_dbs(MYSQL *mysql, const char *wild)
763 {
764  char buff[255];
765  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_list_dbs");
766 
767  append_wild(strmov(buff,"show databases"),buff+sizeof(buff),wild);
768  if (mysql_query(mysql,buff))
769  DBUG_RETURN(0);
770  DBUG_RETURN (mysql_store_result(mysql));
771 }

792 MYSQL_FIELD *cli_list_fields(MYSQL *mysql)
793 {
794  MYSQL_DATA *query;
795  if (!(query= cli_read_rows(mysql,(MYSQL_FIELD*) 0,
796  protocol_41(mysql) ? 8 : 6)))
797  return NULL;
798 
799  mysql->field_count= (uint) query->rows;
800  return unpack_fields(query,&mysql->field_alloc,
801  mysql->field_count, 1, mysql->server_capabilities);
802 }

805 /**************************************************************************
806  List all fields in a table
807  If wild is given then only the fields matching wild is returned
808  Instead of this use query:
809  show fields in 'table' like "wild"
810 **************************************************************************/
811 
812 MYSQL_RES * STDCALL
813 mysql_list_fields(MYSQL *mysql, const char *table, const char *wild)
814 {
815  MYSQL_RES *result;
816  MYSQL_FIELD *fields;
817  char buff[258],*end;
818  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_list_fields");
819  DBUG_PRINT("enter",("table: '%s' wild: '%s'",table,wild ? wild : ""));
820 
821  end=strmake(strmake(buff, table,128)+1,wild ? wild : "",128);
822  free_old_query(mysql);
823  if (simple_command(mysql, COM_FIELD_LIST, (uchar*) buff,
824  (ulong) (end-buff), 1) ||
825  !(fields= (*mysql->methods->list_fields)(mysql)))
826  DBUG_RETURN(NULL);
827 
828  if (!(result = (MYSQL_RES *) my_malloc(sizeof(MYSQL_RES),
829  MYF(MY_WME | MY_ZEROFILL))))
830  DBUG_RETURN(NULL);
831 
832  result->methods= mysql->methods;
833  result->field_alloc=mysql->field_alloc;
834  mysql->fields=0;
835  result->field_count = mysql->field_count;
836  result->fields= fields;
837  result->eof=1;
838  DBUG_RETURN(result);
839 }

841 /* List all running processes (threads) in server */
842 
843 MYSQL_RES * STDCALL
844 mysql_list_processes(MYSQL *mysql)
845 {
846  MYSQL_DATA *fields;
847  uint field_count;
848  uchar *pos;
849  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_list_processes");
850 
851  LINT_INIT(fields);
852  if (simple_command(mysql,COM_PROCESS_INFO,0,0,0))
853  DBUG_RETURN(0);
854  free_old_query(mysql);
855  pos=(uchar*) mysql->net.read_pos;
856  field_count=(uint) net_field_length(&pos);
857  if (!(fields = (*mysql->methods->read_rows)(mysql,(MYSQL_FIELD*) 0,
858  protocol_41(mysql) ? 7 : 5)))
859  DBUG_RETURN(NULL);
860  if (!(mysql->fields=unpack_fields(fields,&mysql->field_alloc,field_count,0,
861  mysql->server_capabilities)))
862  DBUG_RETURN(0);
863  mysql->status=MYSQL_STATUS_GET_RESULT;
864  mysql->field_count=field_count;
865  DBUG_RETURN(mysql_store_result(mysql));
866 }

1100 /****************************************************************************
1101  Some support functions
1102 ****************************************************************************/

1104 /*
1105  Functions called my my_net_init() to set some application specific variables
1106 */
1107 
1108 void my_net_local_init(NET *net)
1109 {
1110  net->max_packet= (uint) net_buffer_length;
1111  my_net_set_read_timeout(net, CLIENT_NET_READ_TIMEOUT);
1112  my_net_set_write_timeout(net, CLIENT_NET_WRITE_TIMEOUT);
1113  net->retry_count= 1;

1116 
1117 /*
1118  This function is used to create HEX string that you
1119  can use in a SQL statement in of the either ways:
1120  INSERT INTO blob_column VALUES (0xAABBCC); (any MySQL version)
1121  INSERT INTO blob_column VALUES (X'AABBCC'); (4.1 and higher)
1122 
1123  The string in "from" is encoded to a HEX string.
1124  The result is placed in "to" and a terminating null byte is appended.
1125 
1126  The string pointed to by "from" must be "length" bytes long.
1127  You must allocate the "to" buffer to be at least length*2+1 bytes long.
1128  Each character needs two bytes, and you need room for the terminating
1129  null byte. When mysql_hex_string() returns, the contents of "to" will
1130  be a null-terminated string. The return value is the length of the
1131  encoded string, not including the terminating null character.
1132 
1133  The return value does not contain any leading 0x or a leading X' and
1134  trailing '. The caller must supply whichever of those is desired.
1135 */
1136 
1137 ulong STDCALL
1138 mysql_hex_string(char *to, const char *from, ulong length)
1139 {
1140  char *to0= to;
1141  const char *end;
1142 
1143  for (end= from + length; from < end; from++)
1144  {
1145  *to++= _dig_vec_upper[((unsigned char) *from) >> 4];
1146  *to++= _dig_vec_upper[((unsigned char) *from) & 0x0F];
1147  }
1148  *to= '\0';
1149  return (ulong) (to-to0);
1150 }
1151 
1152 /*
1153  Add escape characters to a string (blob?) to make it suitable for a insert
1154  to should at least have place for length*2+1 chars
1155  Returns the length of the to string
1156 */
1157 
1158 ulong STDCALL
1159 mysql_escape_string(char *to,const char *from,ulong length)
1160 {
1161  return (uint) escape_string_for_mysql(default_charset_info, to, 0, from, length);
1162 }
1163 
1164 ulong STDCALL
1165 mysql_real_escape_string(MYSQL *mysql, char *to,const char *from,
1166  ulong length)
1167 {
1168  if (mysql->server_status & SERVER_STATUS_NO_BACKSLASH_ESCAPES)
1169  return (uint) escape_quotes_for_mysql(mysql->charset, to, 0, from, length);
1170  return (uint) escape_string_for_mysql(mysql->charset, to, 0, from, length);
1171 }
1172 
1173 void STDCALL
1174 myodbc_remove_escape(MYSQL *mysql,char *name)
1175 {
1176  char *to;
1177 #ifdef USE_MB
1178  my_bool use_mb_flag=use_mb(mysql->charset);
1179  char *UNINIT_VAR(end);
1180  if (use_mb_flag)
1181  for (end=name; *end ; end++) ;
1182 #endif
1183 
1184  for (to=name ; *name ; name++)
1185  {
1186 #ifdef USE_MB
1187  int l;
1188  if (use_mb_flag && (l = my_ismbchar( mysql->charset, name , end ) ) )
1189  {
1190  while (l--)
1191  *to++ = *name++;
1192  name--;
1193  continue;
1194  }
1195 #endif
1196  if (*name == '\\' && name[1])
1197  name++;
1198  *to++= *name;
1199  }
1200  *to=0;
1201 }

1203 /********************************************************************
1204  Implementation of new client API for 4.1 version.
1205 
1206  mysql_stmt_* are real prototypes used by applications.
1207 
1208  To make API work in embedded library all functions performing
1209  real I/O are prefixed with 'cli_' (abbreviated from 'Call Level
1210  Interface'). This functions are invoked via pointers set in
1211  MYSQL::methods structure. Embedded counterparts, prefixed with
1212  'emb_' reside in libmysqld/lib_sql.cc.
1213 *********************************************************************/
1214 
1215 /******************* Declarations ***********************************/
1216 
1217 /* Default number of rows fetched per one COM_STMT_FETCH command. */
1218 
1219 #define DEFAULT_PREFETCH_ROWS (ulong) 1
1220 
1221 /*
1222  These functions are called by function pointer MYSQL_STMT::read_row_func.
1223  Each function corresponds to one of the read methods:
1224  - mysql_stmt_fetch without prior mysql_stmt_store_result,
1225  - mysql_stmt_fetch when result is stored,
1226  - mysql_stmt_fetch when there are no rows (always returns MYSQL_NO_DATA)
1227 */
1228 
1229 static int stmt_read_row_unbuffered(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, unsigned char **row);
1230 static int stmt_read_row_buffered(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, unsigned char **row);
1231 static int stmt_read_row_from_cursor(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, unsigned char **row);
1232 static int stmt_read_row_no_data(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, unsigned char **row);
1233 static int stmt_read_row_no_result_set(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, unsigned char **row);
1234 
1235 /*
1236  This function is used in mysql_stmt_store_result if
1237  STMT_ATTR_UPDATE_MAX_LENGTH attribute is set.

1239 static void stmt_update_metadata(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, MYSQL_ROWS *data);
1240 static my_bool setup_one_fetch_function(MYSQL_BIND *, MYSQL_FIELD *field);

1251 /*
1252  Maximum sizes of MYSQL_TYPE_DATE, MYSQL_TYPE_TIME, MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME
1253  values stored in network buffer.
1254 */
1255 
1256 /* 1 (length) + 2 (year) + 1 (month) + 1 (day) */
1257 #define MAX_DATE_REP_LENGTH 5
1258 
1259 /*
1260  1 (length) + 1 (is negative) + 4 (day count) + 1 (hour)
1261  + 1 (minute) + 1 (seconds) + 4 (microseconds)
1262 */
1263 #define MAX_TIME_REP_LENGTH 13
1264 
1265 /*
1266  1 (length) + 2 (year) + 1 (month) + 1 (day) +
1267  1 (hour) + 1 (minute) + 1 (second) + 4 (microseconds)
1268 */
1269 #define MAX_DATETIME_REP_LENGTH 12
1270 
1271 #define MAX_DOUBLE_STRING_REP_LENGTH 331
1272 
1273 /* A macro to check truncation errors */
1274 
1275 #define IS_TRUNCATED(value, is_unsigned, min, max, umax) \
1276  ((is_unsigned) ? (((value) > (umax) || (value) < 0) ? 1 : 0) : \
1277  (((value) > (max) || (value) < (min)) ? 1 : 0))
1278 
1279 #define BIND_RESULT_DONE 1
1280 /*
1281  We report truncations only if at least one of MYSQL_BIND::error
1282  pointers is set. In this case stmt->bind_result_done |-ed with
1283  this flag.
1284 */
1285 #define REPORT_DATA_TRUNCATION 2
1286 
1287 /**************** Misc utility functions ****************************/
1288 
1289 /*
1290  Reallocate the NET package to have at least length bytes available.
1291 
1292  SYNPOSIS
1293  my_realloc_str()
1294  net The NET structure to modify.
1295  length Ensure that net->buff has space for at least
1296  this number of bytes.
1297 
1298  RETURN VALUES
1299  0 Success.
1300  1 Error, i.e. out of memory or requested packet size is bigger
1301  than max_allowed_packet. The error code is stored in net->last_errno.
1302 */
1303 
1304 static my_bool my_realloc_str(NET *net, ulong length)
1305 {
1306  ulong buf_length= (ulong) (net->write_pos - net->buff);
1307  my_bool res=0;
1308  DBUG_ENTER("my_realloc_str");
1309  if (buf_length + length > net->max_packet)
1310  {
1311  res= net_realloc(net, buf_length + length);
1312  if (res)
1313  {
1314  strmov(net->sqlstate, unknown_sqlstate);
1315  strmov(net->last_error, ER(net->last_errno));
1316  }
1317  net->write_pos= net->buff+ buf_length;
1318  }
1319  DBUG_RETURN(res);
1320 }

1324 {
1325  if (stmt->last_errno)
1326  {
1327  stmt->last_errno= 0;
1328  stmt->last_error[0]= '\0';
1329  strmov(stmt->sqlstate, not_error_sqlstate);
1330  }
1331 }

1338 void set_stmt_error(MYSQL_STMT * stmt, int errcode,
1339  const char *sqlstate, const char *err)
1340 {
1341  DBUG_ENTER("set_stmt_error");
1342  DBUG_PRINT("enter", ("error: %d '%s'", errcode, ER(errcode)));
1343  DBUG_ASSERT(stmt != 0);
1344 
1345  if (err == 0)
1346  err= ER(errcode);
1347 
1348  stmt->last_errno= errcode;
1349  strmov(stmt->last_error, ER(errcode));
1350  strmov(stmt->sqlstate, sqlstate);
1351 
1352  DBUG_VOID_RETURN;
1353 }

1363 void set_stmt_errmsg(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, NET *net)
1364 {
1365  DBUG_ENTER("set_stmt_errmsg");
1366  DBUG_PRINT("enter", ("error: %d/%s '%s'",
1367  net->last_errno,
1368  net->sqlstate,
1369  net->last_error));
1370  DBUG_ASSERT(stmt != 0);
1371

1373  if (net->last_error && net->last_error[0])
1374  strmov(stmt->last_error, net->last_error);

1378 }
1379 
1380 /*
1381  Read and unpack server reply to COM_STMT_PREPARE command (sent from
1382  mysql_stmt_prepare).
1383 
1384  SYNOPSIS
1385  cli_read_prepare_result()
1386  mysql connection handle
1387  stmt statement handle
1388 
1389  RETURN VALUES
1390  0 ok
1391  1 error
1392 */
1393 
1394 my_bool cli_read_prepare_result(MYSQL *mysql, MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
1395 {
1396  uchar *pos;
1397  uint field_count, param_count;
1398  ulong packet_length;
1399  MYSQL_DATA *fields_data;
1400  DBUG_ENTER("cli_read_prepare_result");
1401 
1402  if ((packet_length= cli_safe_read(mysql)) == packet_error)
1403  DBUG_RETURN(1);
1404  mysql->warning_count= 0;
1405 
1406  pos= (uchar*) mysql->net.read_pos;
1407  stmt->stmt_id= uint4korr(pos+1); pos+= 5;
1408  /* Number of columns in result set */
1409  field_count= uint2korr(pos); pos+= 2;
1410  /* Number of placeholders in the statement */
1411  param_count= uint2korr(pos); pos+= 2;
1412  if (packet_length >= 12)
1413  mysql->warning_count= uint2korr(pos+1);
1414 
1415  if (param_count != 0)
1416  {
1417  MYSQL_DATA *param_data;
1418 
1419  /* skip parameters data: we don't support it yet */
1420  if (!(param_data= (*mysql->methods->read_rows)(mysql, (MYSQL_FIELD*)0, 7)))
1421  DBUG_RETURN(1);
1422  free_rows(param_data);
1423  }
1424 
1425  if (field_count != 0)
1426  {
1427  if (!(mysql->server_status & SERVER_STATUS_AUTOCOMMIT))
1428  mysql->server_status|= SERVER_STATUS_IN_TRANS;
1429 
1430  if (!(fields_data= (*mysql->methods->read_rows)(mysql,(MYSQL_FIELD*)0,7)))
1431  DBUG_RETURN(1);
1432  if (!(stmt->fields= unpack_fields(fields_data,&stmt->mem_root,
1433  field_count,0,
1434  mysql->server_capabilities)))
1435  DBUG_RETURN(1);
1436  }
1437  stmt->field_count= field_count;
1438  stmt->param_count= (ulong) param_count;
1439  DBUG_PRINT("exit",("field_count: %u param_count: %u warning_count: %u",
1440  field_count, param_count, (uint) mysql->warning_count));
1441 
1442  DBUG_RETURN(0);
1443 }
1444 
1445 
1446 /*
1447  Allocate memory and init prepared statement structure.
1448 
1449  SYNOPSIS
1450  mysql_stmt_init()
1451  mysql connection handle
1452 
1453  DESCRIPTION
1454  This is an entry point of the new API. Returned handle stands for
1455  a server-side prepared statement. Memory for this structure (~700
1456  bytes) is allocated using 'malloc'. Once created, the handle can be
1457  reused many times. Created statement handle is bound to connection
1458  handle provided to this call: its lifetime is limited by lifetime
1459  of connection.
1460  'mysql_stmt_init()' is a pure local call, server side structure is
1461  created only in mysql_stmt_prepare.
1462  Next steps you may want to make:
1463  - set a statement attribute (mysql_stmt_attr_set()),
1464  - prepare statement handle with a query (mysql_stmt_prepare()),
1465  - close statement handle and free its memory (mysql_stmt_close()),
1466  - reset statement with mysql_stmt_reset() (a no-op which will
1467  just return).
1468  Behaviour of the rest of API calls on this statement is not defined yet
1469  (though we're working on making each wrong call sequence return
1470  error).
1471 
1472  RETURN VALUE
1473  statement structure upon success and NULL if out of
1474  memory
1475 */
1476 
1477 MYSQL_STMT * STDCALL
1478 mysql_stmt_init(MYSQL *mysql)
1479 {
1480  MYSQL_STMT *stmt;
1481  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_init");
1482 
1483  if (!(stmt= (MYSQL_STMT *) my_malloc(sizeof(MYSQL_STMT),
1484  MYF(MY_WME | MY_ZEROFILL))))
1485  {
1486  set_mysql_error(mysql, CR_OUT_OF_MEMORY, unknown_sqlstate);
1487  DBUG_RETURN(0);
1488  }
1489 
1490  init_alloc_root(&stmt->mem_root, 2048, 2048);
1491  init_alloc_root(&stmt->result.alloc, 4096, 4096);
1492  stmt->result.alloc.min_malloc= sizeof(MYSQL_ROWS);
1493  mysql->stmts= list_add(mysql->stmts, &stmt->list);
1494  stmt->list.data= stmt;
1495  stmt->state= MYSQL_STMT_INIT_DONE;
1496  stmt->mysql= mysql;
1497  stmt->read_row_func= stmt_read_row_no_result_set;
1498  stmt->prefetch_rows= DEFAULT_PREFETCH_ROWS;
1499  strmov(stmt->sqlstate, not_error_sqlstate);
1500  /* The rest of statement members was bzeroed inside malloc */
1501 
1502  DBUG_RETURN(stmt);
1503 }
1504 
1505 
1506 /*
1507  Prepare server side statement with query.
1508 
1509  SYNOPSIS
1510  mysql_stmt_prepare()
1511  stmt statement handle
1512  query statement to prepare
1513  length statement length
1514 
1515  DESCRIPTION
1516  Associate statement with statement handle. This is done both on
1517  client and server sides. At this point the server parses given query
1518  and creates an internal structure to represent it.
1519  Next steps you may want to make:
1520  - find out if this statement returns a result set by
1521  calling mysql_stmt_field_count(), and get result set metadata
1522  with mysql_stmt_result_metadata(),
1523  - if query contains placeholders, bind input parameters to placeholders
1524  using mysql_stmt_bind_param(),
1525  - otherwise proceed directly to mysql_stmt_execute().
1526 
1527  IMPLEMENTATION NOTES
1528  - if this is a re-prepare of the statement, first close previous data
1529  structure on the server and free old statement data
1530  - then send the query to server and get back number of placeholders,
1531  number of columns in result set (if any), and result set metadata.
1532  At the same time allocate memory for input and output parameters
1533  to have less checks in mysql_stmt_bind_{param, result}.
1534 
1535  RETURN VALUES
1536  0 success
1537  !0 error
1538 */
1539 
1540 int STDCALL
1541 mysql_stmt_prepare(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, const char *query, ulong length)
1542 {
1543  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
1544  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_prepare");
1545 
1546  if (!mysql)
1547  {
1548  /* mysql can be reset in mysql_close called from mysql_reconnect */
1549  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_SERVER_LOST, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
1550  DBUG_RETURN(1);
1551  }
1552 
1553  /*
1554  Reset the last error in any case: that would clear the statement
1555  if the previous prepare failed.
1556  */
1557  stmt->last_errno= 0;
1558  stmt->last_error[0]= '\0';
1559 
1560  if ((int) stmt->state > (int) MYSQL_STMT_INIT_DONE)
1561  {
1562  /* This is second prepare with another statement */
1563  uchar buff[MYSQL_STMT_HEADER]; /* 4 bytes - stmt id */
1564 
1565  if (reset_stmt_handle(stmt, RESET_LONG_DATA | RESET_STORE_RESULT))
1566  DBUG_RETURN(1);
1567  /*
1568  These members must be reset for API to
1569  function in case of error or misuse.
1570  */
1571  stmt->bind_param_done= stmt->bind_result_done= FALSE;
1572  stmt->param_count= stmt->field_count= 0;
1573  free_root(&stmt->mem_root, MYF(MY_KEEP_PREALLOC));
1574 
1575  int4store(buff, stmt->stmt_id);
1576 
1577  /*
1578  Close statement in server
1579 
1580  If there was a 'use' result from another statement, or from
1581  mysql_use_result it won't be freed in mysql_stmt_free_result and
1582  we should get 'Commands out of sync' here.
1583  */
1584  stmt->state= MYSQL_STMT_INIT_DONE;
1585  if (stmt_command(mysql, COM_STMT_CLOSE, buff, 4, stmt))
1586  {
1587  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, &mysql->net);
1588  DBUG_RETURN(1);
1589  }
1590  }
1591 
1592  if (stmt_command(mysql, COM_STMT_PREPARE, (const uchar*) query, length, stmt))
1593  {
1594  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, &mysql->net);
1595  DBUG_RETURN(1);
1596  }
1597 
1598  if ((*mysql->methods->read_prepare_result)(mysql, stmt))
1599  {
1600  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, &mysql->net);
1601  DBUG_RETURN(1);
1602  }
1603 
1604  /*
1605  alloc_root will return valid address even in case when param_count
1606  and field_count are zero. Thus we should never rely on stmt->bind
1607  or stmt->params when checking for existence of placeholders or
1608  result set.
1609  */
1610  if (!(stmt->params= (MYSQL_BIND *) alloc_root(&stmt->mem_root,
1611  sizeof(MYSQL_BIND)*
1612  (stmt->param_count +
1613  stmt->field_count))))
1614  {
1615  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_OUT_OF_MEMORY, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
1616  DBUG_RETURN(1);
1617  }
1618  stmt->bind= stmt->params + stmt->param_count;
1619  stmt->state= MYSQL_STMT_PREPARE_DONE;
1620  DBUG_PRINT("info", ("Parameter count: %u", stmt->param_count));
1621  DBUG_RETURN(0);
1622 }
1623 
1624 /*
1625  Get result set metadata from reply to mysql_stmt_execute.
1626  This is used mainly for SHOW commands, as metadata for these
1627  commands is sent only with result set.
1628  To be removed when all commands will fully support prepared mode.
1629 */
1630 
1631 static void alloc_stmt_fields(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
1632 {
1633  MYSQL_FIELD *fields, *field, *end;
1634  MEM_ROOT *alloc= &stmt->mem_root;
1635  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
1636 
1637  DBUG_ASSERT(mysql->field_count);
1638 
1639  stmt->field_count= mysql->field_count;
1640 
1641  /*
1642  Get the field information for non-select statements
1643  like SHOW and DESCRIBE commands
1644  */
1645  if (!(stmt->fields= (MYSQL_FIELD *) alloc_root(alloc,
1646  sizeof(MYSQL_FIELD) *
1647  stmt->field_count)) ||
1648  !(stmt->bind= (MYSQL_BIND *) alloc_root(alloc,
1649  sizeof(MYSQL_BIND) *
1650  stmt->field_count)))
1651  {
1652  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_OUT_OF_MEMORY, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
1653  return;
1654  }
1655 
1656  for (fields= mysql->fields, end= fields+stmt->field_count,
1657  field= stmt->fields;
1658  field && fields < end; fields++, field++)
1659  {
1660  *field= *fields; /* To copy all numeric parts. */
1661  field->catalog= strmake_root(alloc, fields->catalog,
1662  fields->catalog_length);
1663  field->db= strmake_root(alloc, fields->db, fields->db_length);
1664  field->table= strmake_root(alloc, fields->table, fields->table_length);
1665  field->org_table= strmake_root(alloc, fields->org_table,
1666  fields->org_table_length);
1667  field->name= strmake_root(alloc, fields->name, fields->name_length);
1668  field->org_name= strmake_root(alloc, fields->org_name,
1669  fields->org_name_length);
1670  field->def= fields->def ? strmake_root(alloc, fields->def,
1671  fields->def_length) : 0;
1672  field->def_length= field->def ? fields->def_length : 0;
1673  field->extension= 0; /* Avoid dangling links. */
1674  field->max_length= 0; /* max_length is set in mysql_stmt_store_result() */
1675  }
1676 }
1677 
1678 
1687 static void update_stmt_fields(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
1688 {
1689  MYSQL_FIELD *field= stmt->mysql->fields;
1690  MYSQL_FIELD *field_end= field + stmt->field_count;
1691  MYSQL_FIELD *stmt_field= stmt->fields;
1692  MYSQL_BIND *my_bind= stmt->bind_result_done ? stmt->bind : 0;
1693 
1694  if (stmt->field_count != stmt->mysql->field_count)
1695  {
1696  /*
1697  The tables used in the statement were altered,
1698  and the query now returns a different number of columns.
1699  There is no way to continue without reallocating the bind
1700  array:
1701  - if the number of columns increased, mysql_stmt_fetch()
1702  will write beyond allocated memory
1703  - if the number of columns decreased, some user-bound
1704  buffers will be left unassigned without user knowing
1705  that.
1706  */
1707  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_NEW_STMT_METADATA, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
1708  return;
1709  }
1710 
1711  for (; field < field_end; ++field, ++stmt_field)
1712  {
1713  stmt_field->charsetnr= field->charsetnr;
1714  stmt_field->length = field->length;
1715  stmt_field->type = field->type;
1716  stmt_field->flags = field->flags;
1717  stmt_field->decimals = field->decimals;
1718  if (my_bind)
1719  {
1720  /* Ignore return value: it should be 0 if bind_result succeeded. */
1721  (void) setup_one_fetch_function(my_bind++, stmt_field);
1722  }
1723  }
1724 }
1725 
1726 /*
1727  Returns prepared statement metadata in the form of a result set.
1728 
1729  SYNOPSIS
1730  mysql_stmt_result_metadata()
1731  stmt statement handle
1732 
1733  DESCRIPTION
1734  This function should be used after mysql_stmt_execute().
1735  You can safely check that prepared statement has a result set by calling
1736  mysql_stmt_field_count(): if number of fields is not zero, you can call
1737  this function to get fields metadata.
1738  Next steps you may want to make:
1739  - find out number of columns in result set by calling
1740  mysql_num_fields(res) (the same value is returned by
1741  mysql_stmt_field_count())
1742  - fetch metadata for any column with mysql_fetch_field,
1743  mysql_fetch_field_direct, mysql_fetch_fields, mysql_field_seek.
1744  - free returned MYSQL_RES structure with mysql_free_result.
1745  - proceed to binding of output parameters.
1746 
1747  RETURN
1748  NULL statement contains no result set or out of memory.
1749  In the latter case you can retreive error message
1750  with mysql_stmt_error.
1751  MYSQL_RES a result set with no rows
1752 */
1753 
1754 MYSQL_RES * STDCALL
1755 mysql_stmt_result_metadata(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
1756 {
1757  MYSQL_RES *result;
1758  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_result_metadata");
1759 
1760  /*
1761  stmt->fields is only defined if stmt->field_count is not null;
1762  stmt->field_count is initialized in prepare.
1763  */
1764  if (!stmt->field_count)
1765  DBUG_RETURN(0);
1766 
1767  if (!(result=(MYSQL_RES*) my_malloc(sizeof(*result),
1768  MYF(MY_WME | MY_ZEROFILL))))
1769  {
1770  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_OUT_OF_MEMORY, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
1771  DBUG_RETURN(0);
1772  }
1773 
1774  result->methods= stmt->mysql->methods;
1775  result->eof= 1; /* Marker for buffered */
1776  result->fields= stmt->fields;
1777  result->field_count= stmt->field_count;
1778  /* The rest of members of 'result' was bzeroed inside malloc */
1779  DBUG_RETURN(result);
1780 }
1781

1784  Returns parameter columns meta information in the form of
1785  result set.

1788  mysql_stmt_param_metadata()
1789  stmt statement handle

1791  DESCRIPTION
1792  This function can be called after you prepared the statement handle

1800 
1801 MYSQL_RES * STDCALL
1802 mysql_stmt_param_metadata(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)

1804  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_param_metadata");

1806  if (!stmt->param_count)
1807  DBUG_RETURN(0);
1808 
1809  /*
1810  TODO: Fix this when server sends the information.
1811  Till then keep a dummy prototype.
1812  */
1813  DBUG_RETURN(0);
1814 }

1816 
1817 /* Store type of parameter in network buffer. */
1818 
1819 static void store_param_type(unsigned char **pos, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1820 {
1821  uint typecode= param->buffer_type | (param->is_unsigned ? 32768 : 0);
1822  int2store(*pos, typecode);
1823  *pos+= 2;
1824 }
1825 
1826 
1827 /*
1828  Functions to store parameter data in network packet.
1829 
1830  SYNOPSIS
1831  store_param_xxx()
1832  net MySQL NET connection
1833  param MySQL bind param
1834 
1835  DESCRIPTION
1836  These funtions are invoked from mysql_stmt_execute() by
1837  MYSQL_BIND::store_param_func pointer. This pointer is set once per
1838  many executions in mysql_stmt_bind_param(). The caller must ensure
1839  that network buffer have enough capacity to store parameter
1840  (MYSQL_BIND::buffer_length contains needed number of bytes).
1841 */
1842 
1843 static void store_param_tinyint(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1844 {
1845  *(net->write_pos++)= *(uchar *) param->buffer;
1846 }
1847 
1848 static void store_param_short(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1849 {
1850  short value= *(short*) param->buffer;
1851  int2store(net->write_pos,value);
1852  net->write_pos+=2;
1853 }
1854 
1855 static void store_param_int32(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1856 {
1857  int32 value= *(int32*) param->buffer;
1858  int4store(net->write_pos,value);
1859  net->write_pos+=4;
1860 }
1861 
1862 static void store_param_int64(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1863 {
1864  longlong value= *(longlong*) param->buffer;
1865  int8store(net->write_pos,value);
1866  net->write_pos+= 8;
1867 }
1868 
1869 static void store_param_float(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1870 {
1871  float value= *(float*) param->buffer;
1872  float4store(net->write_pos, value);
1873  net->write_pos+= 4;
1874 }
1875 
1876 static void store_param_double(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1877 {
1878  double value= *(double*) param->buffer;
1879  float8store(net->write_pos, value);
1880  net->write_pos+= 8;
1881 }
1882 
1883 static void store_param_time(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1884 {
1885  MYSQL_TIME *tm= (MYSQL_TIME *) param->buffer;
1886  char buff[MAX_TIME_REP_LENGTH], *pos;
1887  uint length;
1888 
1889  pos= buff+1;
1890  pos[0]= tm->neg ? 1: 0;
1891  int4store(pos+1, tm->day);
1892  pos[5]= (uchar) tm->hour;
1893  pos[6]= (uchar) tm->minute;
1894  pos[7]= (uchar) tm->second;
1895  int4store(pos+8, tm->second_part);
1896  if (tm->second_part)
1897  length= 12;
1898  else if (tm->hour || tm->minute || tm->second || tm->day)
1899  length= 8;
1900  else
1901  length= 0;
1902  buff[0]= (char) length++;
1903  memcpy((char *)net->write_pos, buff, length);
1904  net->write_pos+= length;
1905 }
1906 
1907 static void net_store_datetime(NET *net, MYSQL_TIME *tm)
1908 {
1909  char buff[MAX_DATETIME_REP_LENGTH], *pos;
1910  uint length;
1911 
1912  pos= buff+1;
1913 
1914  int2store(pos, tm->year);
1915  pos[2]= (uchar) tm->month;
1916  pos[3]= (uchar) tm->day;
1917  pos[4]= (uchar) tm->hour;
1918  pos[5]= (uchar) tm->minute;
1919  pos[6]= (uchar) tm->second;
1920  int4store(pos+7, tm->second_part);
1921  if (tm->second_part)
1922  length= 11;
1923  else if (tm->hour || tm->minute || tm->second)
1924  length= 7;
1925  else if (tm->year || tm->month || tm->day)
1926  length= 4;
1927  else
1928  length= 0;
1929  buff[0]= (char) length++;
1930  memcpy((char *)net->write_pos, buff, length);
1931  net->write_pos+= length;
1932 }
1933 
1934 static void store_param_date(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1935 {
1936  MYSQL_TIME tm= *((MYSQL_TIME *) param->buffer);
1937  tm.hour= tm.minute= tm.second= tm.second_part= 0;
1938  net_store_datetime(net, &tm);
1939 }
1940 
1941 static void store_param_datetime(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1942 {
1943  MYSQL_TIME *tm= (MYSQL_TIME *) param->buffer;
1944  net_store_datetime(net, tm);
1945 }
1946 
1947 static void store_param_str(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1948 {
1949  /* param->length is always set in mysql_stmt_bind_param */
1950  ulong length= *param->length;
1951  uchar *to= net_store_length(net->write_pos, length);
1952  memcpy(to, param->buffer, length);
1953  net->write_pos= to+length;
1954 }
1955 
1956 
1957 /*
1958  Mark if the parameter is NULL.
1959 
1960  SYNOPSIS
1961  store_param_null()
1962  net MySQL NET connection
1963  param MySQL bind param
1964 
1965  DESCRIPTION
1966  A data package starts with a string of bits where we set a bit
1967  if a parameter is NULL. Unlike bit string in result set row, here
1968  we don't have reserved bits for OK/error packet.
1969 */
1970 
1971 static void store_param_null(NET *net, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1972 {
1973  uint pos= param->param_number;
1974  net->buff[pos/8]|= (uchar) (1 << (pos & 7));
1975 }
1976 
1977 
1978 /*
1979  Store one parameter in network packet: data is read from
1980  client buffer and saved in network packet by means of one
1981  of store_param_xxxx functions.
1982 */
1983 
1984 static my_bool store_param(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, MYSQL_BIND *param)
1985 {
1986  NET *net= &stmt->mysql->net;
1987  DBUG_ENTER("store_param");
1988  DBUG_PRINT("enter",("type: %d buffer: 0x%lx length: %lu is_null: %d",
1989  param->buffer_type,
1990  (long) (param->buffer ? param->buffer : NullS),
1991  *param->length, *param->is_null));
1992 
1993  if (*param->is_null)
1994  store_param_null(net, param);
1995  else
1996  {
1997  /*
1998  Param->length should ALWAYS point to the correct length for the type
1999  Either to the length pointer given by the user or param->buffer_length
2000  */
2001  if ((my_realloc_str(net, *param->length)))
2002  {
2003  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, net);
2004  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2005  }
2006  (*param->store_param_func)(net, param);
2007  }
2008  DBUG_RETURN(0);
2009 }
2010 
2011 
2012 /*
2013  Auxilary function to send COM_STMT_EXECUTE packet to server and read reply.
2014  Used from cli_stmt_execute, which is in turn used by mysql_stmt_execute.
2015 */
2016 
2017 static my_bool execute(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, char *packet, ulong length)
2018 {
2019  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
2020  NET *net= &mysql->net;
2021  uchar buff[4 /* size of stmt id */ +
2022  5 /* execution flags */];
2023  my_bool res;
2024  DBUG_ENTER("execute");
2025  DBUG_DUMP("packet", (uchar *) packet, length);
2026 
2027  int4store(buff, stmt->stmt_id); /* Send stmt id to server */
2028  buff[4]= (char) stmt->flags;
2029  int4store(buff+5, 1); /* iteration count */
2030 
2031  res= test(cli_advanced_command(mysql, COM_STMT_EXECUTE, buff, sizeof(buff),
2032  (uchar*) packet, length, 1, stmt) ||
2033  (*mysql->methods->read_query_result)(mysql));
2034  stmt->affected_rows= mysql->affected_rows;
2035  stmt->server_status= mysql->server_status;
2036  stmt->insert_id= mysql->insert_id;
2037  if (res)
2038  {
2039  /*
2040  Don't set stmt error if stmt->mysql is NULL, as the error in this case
2041  has already been set by mysql_prune_stmt_list().
2042  */
2043  if (stmt->mysql)
2044  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, net);
2045  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2046  }
2047  else if (mysql->status == MYSQL_STATUS_GET_RESULT)
2048  stmt->mysql->status= MYSQL_STATUS_STATEMENT_GET_RESULT;
2049  DBUG_RETURN(0);
2050 }
2051 
2052 
2053 int cli_stmt_execute(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
2054 {
2055  DBUG_ENTER("cli_stmt_execute");
2056 
2057  if (stmt->param_count)
2058  {
2059  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
2060  NET *net= &mysql->net;
2061  MYSQL_BIND *param, *param_end;
2062  char *param_data;
2063  ulong length;
2064  uint null_count;
2065  my_bool result;
2066 
2067  if (!stmt->bind_param_done)
2068  {
2069  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_PARAMS_NOT_BOUND, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
2070  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2071  }
2072  if (mysql->status != MYSQL_STATUS_READY ||
2073  mysql->server_status & SERVER_MORE_RESULTS_EXISTS)
2074  {
2075  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_COMMANDS_OUT_OF_SYNC, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
2076  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2077  }
2078 
2079  net_clear(net, 1); /* Sets net->write_pos */
2080  /* Reserve place for null-marker bytes */
2081  null_count= (stmt->param_count+7) /8;
2082  if (my_realloc_str(net, null_count + 1))
2083  {
2084  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, net);
2085  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2086  }
2087  bzero((char*) net->write_pos, null_count);
2088  net->write_pos+= null_count;
2089  param_end= stmt->params + stmt->param_count;
2090 
2091  /* In case if buffers (type) altered, indicate to server */
2092  *(net->write_pos)++= (uchar) stmt->send_types_to_server;
2093  if (stmt->send_types_to_server)
2094  {
2095  if (my_realloc_str(net, 2 * stmt->param_count))
2096  {
2097  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, net);
2098  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2099  }
2100  /*
2101  Store types of parameters in first in first package
2102  that is sent to the server.
2103  */
2104  for (param= stmt->params; param < param_end ; param++)
2105  store_param_type(&net->write_pos, param);
2106  }
2107 
2108  for (param= stmt->params; param < param_end; param++)
2109  {
2110  /* check if mysql_stmt_send_long_data() was used */
2111  if (param->long_data_used)
2112  param->long_data_used= 0; /* Clear for next execute call */
2113  else if (store_param(stmt, param))
2114  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2115  }
2116  length= (ulong) (net->write_pos - net->buff);
2117  /* TODO: Look into avoding the following memdup */
2118  if (!(param_data= my_memdup(net->buff, length, MYF(0))))
2119  {
2120  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_OUT_OF_MEMORY, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
2121  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2122  }
2123  result= execute(stmt, param_data, length);
2124  stmt->send_types_to_server=0;
2125  my_free(param_data);
2126  DBUG_RETURN(result);
2127  }
2128  DBUG_RETURN((int) execute(stmt,0,0));
2129 }
2130 
2131 /*
2132  Read one row from buffered result set. Result set is created by prior
2133  call to mysql_stmt_store_result().
2134  SYNOPSIS
2135  stmt_read_row_buffered()
2136 
2137  RETURN VALUE
2138  0 - success; *row is set to valid row pointer (row data
2139  is stored in result set buffer)
2140  MYSQL_NO_DATA - end of result set. *row is set to NULL
2141 */
2142 
2143 static int stmt_read_row_buffered(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, unsigned char **row)
2144 {
2145  if (stmt->data_cursor)
2146  {
2147  *row= (uchar *) stmt->data_cursor->data;
2148  stmt->data_cursor= stmt->data_cursor->next;
2149  return 0;
2150  }
2151  *row= 0;
2152  return MYSQL_NO_DATA;
2153 }
2154 
2155 /*
2156  Read one row from network: unbuffered non-cursor fetch.
2157  If last row was read, or error occured, erase this statement
2158  from record pointing to object unbuffered fetch is performed from.
2159 
2160  SYNOPSIS
2161  stmt_read_row_unbuffered()
2162  stmt statement handle
2163  row pointer to write pointer to row data;
2164 
2165  RETURN VALUE
2166  0 - success; *row contains valid address of a row;
2167  row data is stored in network buffer
2168  1 - error; error code is written to
2169  stmt->last_{errno,error}; *row is not changed
2170  MYSQL_NO_DATA - end of file was read from network;
2171  *row is set to NULL
2172 */
2173 
2174 static int stmt_read_row_unbuffered(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, unsigned char **row)
2175 {
2176  int rc= 1;
2177  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
2178  /*
2179  This function won't be called if stmt->field_count is zero
2180  or execution wasn't done: this is ensured by mysql_stmt_execute.
2181  */
2182  if (!mysql)
2183  {
2184  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_SERVER_LOST, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
2185  return 1;
2186  }
2187  if (mysql->status != MYSQL_STATUS_STATEMENT_GET_RESULT)
2188  {
2189  set_stmt_error(stmt, stmt->unbuffered_fetch_cancelled ?
2190  CR_FETCH_CANCELED : CR_COMMANDS_OUT_OF_SYNC,
2191  unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
2192  goto error;
2193  }
2194  if ((*mysql->methods->unbuffered_fetch)(mysql, (char**) row))
2195  {
2196  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, &mysql->net);
2197  /*
2198  If there was an error, there are no more pending rows:
2199  reset statement status to not hang up in following
2200  mysql_stmt_close (it will try to flush result set before
2201  closing the statement).
2202  */
2203  mysql->status= MYSQL_STATUS_READY;
2204  goto error;
2205  }
2206  if (!*row)
2207  {
2208  mysql->status= MYSQL_STATUS_READY;
2209  rc= MYSQL_NO_DATA;
2210  goto error;
2211  }
2212  return 0;
2213 error:
2214  if (mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner == &stmt->unbuffered_fetch_cancelled)
2215  mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner= 0;
2216  return rc;
2217 }
2218 
2219 
2220 /*
2221  Fetch statement row using server side cursor.
2222 
2223  SYNOPSIS
2224  stmt_read_row_from_cursor()
2225 
2226  RETURN VALUE
2227  0 success
2228  1 error
2229  MYSQL_NO_DATA end of data
2230 */
2231 
2232 static int
2233 stmt_read_row_from_cursor(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, unsigned char **row)
2234 {
2235  if (stmt->data_cursor)
2236  return stmt_read_row_buffered(stmt, row);
2237  if (stmt->server_status & SERVER_STATUS_LAST_ROW_SENT)
2238  stmt->server_status &= ~SERVER_STATUS_LAST_ROW_SENT;
2239  else
2240  {
2241  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
2242  NET *net= &mysql->net;
2243  MYSQL_DATA *result= &stmt->result;
2244  uchar buff[4 /* statement id */ +
2245  4 /* number of rows to fetch */];
2246 
2247  free_root(&result->alloc, MYF(MY_KEEP_PREALLOC));
2248  result->data= NULL;
2249  result->rows= 0;
2250  /* Send row request to the server */
2251  int4store(buff, stmt->stmt_id);
2252  int4store(buff + 4, stmt->prefetch_rows); /* number of rows to fetch */
2253  if ((*mysql->methods->advanced_command)(mysql, COM_STMT_FETCH,
2254  buff, sizeof(buff), (uchar*) 0, 0,
2255  1, stmt))
2256  {
2257  /*
2258  Don't set stmt error if stmt->mysql is NULL, as the error in this case
2259  has already been set by mysql_prune_stmt_list().
2260  */
2261  if (stmt->mysql)
2262  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, net);
2263  return 1;
2264  }
2265  if ((*mysql->methods->read_rows_from_cursor)(stmt))
2266  return 1;
2267  stmt->server_status= mysql->server_status;
2268 
2269  stmt->data_cursor= result->data;
2270  return stmt_read_row_buffered(stmt, row);
2271  }
2272  *row= 0;
2273  return MYSQL_NO_DATA;
2274 }
2275

2278  Default read row function to not SIGSEGV in client in
2279  case of wrong sequence of API calls.
2280 */
2281 
2282 static int
2283 stmt_read_row_no_data(MYSQL_STMT *stmt __attribute__((unused)),
2284  unsigned char **row __attribute__((unused)))

2286  return MYSQL_NO_DATA;

2290 stmt_read_row_no_result_set(MYSQL_STMT *stmt __attribute__((unused)),
2291  unsigned char **row __attribute__((unused)))
2292 {
2293  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_NO_RESULT_SET, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);

2297 
2298 /*
2299  Get/set statement attributes
2300 
2301  SYNOPSIS
2302  mysql_stmt_attr_get()
2303  mysql_stmt_attr_set()
2304 
2305  attr_type statement attribute
2306  value cast to const void * pointer to value.
2307 
2308  RETURN VALUE
2309  0 success
2310  !0 wrong attribute type
2311 */
2312 
2313 my_bool STDCALL mysql_stmt_attr_set(MYSQL_STMT *stmt,
2314  enum enum_stmt_attr_type attr_type,
2315  const void *value)
2316 {
2317  switch (attr_type) {
2318  case STMT_ATTR_UPDATE_MAX_LENGTH:
2319  stmt->update_max_length= value ? *(const my_bool*) value : 0;
2320  break;
2321  case STMT_ATTR_CURSOR_TYPE:
2322  {
2323  ulong cursor_type;
2324  cursor_type= value ? *(ulong*) value : 0UL;
2325  if (cursor_type > (ulong) CURSOR_TYPE_READ_ONLY)
2326  goto err_not_implemented;
2327  stmt->flags= cursor_type;
2328  break;
2329  }
2330  case STMT_ATTR_PREFETCH_ROWS:
2331  {
2332  ulong prefetch_rows= value ? *(ulong*) value : DEFAULT_PREFETCH_ROWS;
2333  if (value == 0)
2334  return TRUE;
2335  stmt->prefetch_rows= prefetch_rows;
2336  break;
2337  }
2338  default:
2339  goto err_not_implemented;
2340  }
2341  return FALSE;
2342 err_not_implemented:
2343  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
2344  return TRUE;
2345 }
2346 
2347 
2348 my_bool STDCALL mysql_stmt_attr_get(MYSQL_STMT *stmt,
2349  enum enum_stmt_attr_type attr_type,
2350  void *value)
2351 {
2352  switch (attr_type) {
2353  case STMT_ATTR_UPDATE_MAX_LENGTH:
2354  *(my_bool*) value= stmt->update_max_length;
2355  break;
2356  case STMT_ATTR_CURSOR_TYPE:
2357  *(ulong*) value= stmt->flags;
2358  break;
2359  case STMT_ATTR_PREFETCH_ROWS:
2360  *(ulong*) value= stmt->prefetch_rows;
2361  break;
2362  default:
2363  return TRUE;
2364  }
2365  return FALSE;
2366 }

2368 
2380 static void reinit_result_set_metadata(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
2381 {
2382  /* Server has sent result set metadata */
2383  if (stmt->field_count == 0)
2384  {
2385  /*
2386  This is 'SHOW'/'EXPLAIN'-like query. Current implementation of
2387  prepared statements can't send result set metadata for these queries
2388  on prepare stage. Read it now.
2389  */
2390  alloc_stmt_fields(stmt);
2391  }
2392  else
2393  {
2394  /*
2395  Update result set metadata if it for some reason changed between
2396  prepare and execute, i.e.:
2397  - in case of 'SELECT ?' we don't know column type unless data was
2398  supplied to mysql_stmt_execute, so updated column type is sent
2399  now.
2400  - if data dictionary changed between prepare and execute, for
2401  example a table used in the query was altered.
2402  Note, that now (4.1.3) we always send metadata in reply to
2403  COM_STMT_EXECUTE (even if it is not necessary), so either this or
2404  previous branch always works.
2405  TODO: send metadata only when it's really necessary and add a warning
2406  'Metadata changed' when it's sent twice.
2407  */
2408  update_stmt_fields(stmt);
2409  }
2410 }
2411 
2412 
2413 static void prepare_to_fetch_result(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
2414 {
2415  if (stmt->server_status & SERVER_STATUS_CURSOR_EXISTS)
2416  {
2417  stmt->mysql->status= MYSQL_STATUS_READY;
2418  stmt->read_row_func= stmt_read_row_from_cursor;
2419  }
2420  else if (stmt->flags & CURSOR_TYPE_READ_ONLY)
2421  {
2422  /*
2423  This is a single-row result set, a result set with no rows, EXPLAIN,
2424  SHOW VARIABLES, or some other command which either a) bypasses the
2425  cursors framework in the server and writes rows directly to the
2426  network or b) is more efficient if all (few) result set rows are
2427  precached on client and server's resources are freed.
2428  */
2429  mysql_stmt_store_result(stmt);
2430  }
2431  else
2432  {
2433  stmt->mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner= &stmt->unbuffered_fetch_cancelled;
2434  stmt->unbuffered_fetch_cancelled= FALSE;
2435  stmt->read_row_func= stmt_read_row_unbuffered;
2436  }
2437 }
2438 
2439 
2440 /*
2441  Send placeholders data to server (if there are placeholders)
2442  and execute prepared statement.
2443 
2444  SYNOPSIS
2445  mysql_stmt_execute()
2446  stmt statement handle. The handle must be created
2447  with mysql_stmt_init() and prepared with
2448  mysql_stmt_prepare(). If there are placeholders
2449  in the statement they must be bound to local
2450  variables with mysql_stmt_bind_param().
2451 
2452  DESCRIPTION
2453  This function will automatically flush pending result
2454  set (if there is one), send parameters data to the server
2455  and read result of statement execution.
2456  If previous result set was cached with mysql_stmt_store_result()
2457  it will also be freed in the beginning of this call.
2458  The server can return 3 types of responses to this command:
2459  - error, can be retrieved with mysql_stmt_error()
2460  - ok, no result set pending. In this case we just update
2461  stmt->insert_id and stmt->affected_rows.
2462  - the query returns a result set: there could be 0 .. N
2463  rows in it. In this case the server can also send updated
2464  result set metadata.
2465 
2466  Next steps you may want to make:
2467  - find out if there is result set with mysql_stmt_field_count().
2468  If there is one:
2469  - optionally, cache entire result set on client to unblock
2470  connection with mysql_stmt_store_result()
2471  - bind client variables to result set columns and start read rows
2472  with mysql_stmt_fetch().
2473  - reset statement with mysql_stmt_reset() or close it with
2474  mysql_stmt_close()
2475  Otherwise:
2476  - find out last insert id and number of affected rows with
2477  mysql_stmt_insert_id(), mysql_stmt_affected_rows()
2478 
2479  RETURN
2480  0 success
2481  1 error, message can be retrieved with mysql_stmt_error().
2482 */
2483 
2484 int STDCALL mysql_stmt_execute(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
2485 {
2486  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
2487  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_execute");
2488 
2489  if (!mysql)
2490  {
2491  /* Error is already set in mysql_detatch_stmt_list */
2492  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2493  }
2494 
2495  if (reset_stmt_handle(stmt, RESET_STORE_RESULT | RESET_CLEAR_ERROR))
2496  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2497  /*
2498  No need to check for stmt->state: if the statement wasn't
2499  prepared we'll get 'unknown statement handler' error from server.
2500  */
2501  if (mysql->methods->stmt_execute(stmt))
2502  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2503  stmt->state= MYSQL_STMT_EXECUTE_DONE;
2504  if (mysql->field_count)
2505  {
2506  reinit_result_set_metadata(stmt);
2507  prepare_to_fetch_result(stmt);
2508  }
2509  DBUG_RETURN(test(stmt->last_errno));
2510 }
2511

2514  Return total parameters count in the statement
2515 */

2517 ulong STDCALL mysql_stmt_param_count(MYSQL_STMT * stmt)

2520  DBUG_RETURN(stmt->param_count);
2521 }

2523 /*
2524  Return total affected rows from the last statement
2525 */
2526 
2527 my_ulonglong STDCALL mysql_stmt_affected_rows(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)

2530 }

2543 /*

2548  stmt statement handle
2549

2551  Current implementation of this call has a caveat: stmt->insert_id is
2552  unconditionally updated from mysql->insert_id in the end of each
2553  mysql_stmt_execute(). This works OK if mysql->insert_id contains new
2554  value (sent in reply to mysql_stmt_execute()), otherwise stmt->insert_id
2555  value gets undefined, as it's updated from some arbitrary value saved in
2556  connection structure during some other call.
2557 */

2563 
2564 
2565 static my_bool int_is_null_true= 1; /* Used for MYSQL_TYPE_NULL */
2566 static my_bool int_is_null_false= 0;
2567 
2568 
2569 /*
2570  Set up input data buffers for a statement.
2571 
2572  SYNOPSIS
2573  mysql_stmt_bind_param()
2574  stmt statement handle
2575  The statement must be prepared with mysql_stmt_prepare().
2576  my_bind Array of mysql_stmt_param_count() bind parameters.
2577  This function doesn't check that size of this argument
2578  is >= mysql_stmt_field_count(): it's user's responsibility.
2579 
2580  DESCRIPTION
2581  Use this call after mysql_stmt_prepare() to bind user variables to
2582  placeholders.
2583  Each element of bind array stands for a placeholder. Placeholders
2584  are counted from 0. For example statement
2585  'INSERT INTO t (a, b) VALUES (?, ?)'
2586  contains two placeholders, and for such statement you should supply
2587  bind array of two elements (MYSQL_BIND bind[2]).
2588 
2589  By properly initializing bind array you can bind virtually any
2590  C language type to statement's placeholders:
2591  First, it's strongly recommended to always zero-initialize entire
2592  bind structure before setting its members. This will both shorten
2593  your application code and make it robust to future extensions of
2594  MYSQL_BIND structure.
2595  Then you need to assign typecode of your application buffer to
2596  MYSQL_BIND::buffer_type. The following typecodes with their
2597  correspondence to C language types are supported:
2598  MYSQL_TYPE_TINY for 8-bit integer variables. Normally it's
2599  'signed char' and 'unsigned char';
2600  MYSQL_TYPE_SHORT for 16-bit signed and unsigned variables. This
2601  is usually 'short' and 'unsigned short';
2602  MYSQL_TYPE_LONG for 32-bit signed and unsigned variables. It
2603  corresponds to 'int' and 'unsigned int' on
2604  vast majority of platforms. On IA-32 and some
2605  other 32-bit systems you can also use 'long'
2606  here;
2607  MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG 64-bit signed or unsigned integer. Stands for
2608  '[unsigned] long long' on most platforms;
2609  MYSQL_TYPE_FLOAT 32-bit floating point type, 'float' on most
2610  systems;
2611  MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE 64-bit floating point type, 'double' on most
2612  systems;
2613  MYSQL_TYPE_TIME broken-down time stored in MYSQL_TIME
2614  structure
2615  MYSQL_TYPE_DATE date stored in MYSQL_TIME structure
2616  MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME datetime stored in MYSQL_TIME structure See
2617  more on how to use these types for sending
2618  dates and times below;
2619  MYSQL_TYPE_STRING character string, assumed to be in
2620  character-set-client. If character set of
2621  client is not equal to character set of
2622  column, value for this placeholder will be
2623  converted to destination character set before
2624  insert.
2625  MYSQL_TYPE_BLOB sequence of bytes. This sequence is assumed to
2626  be in binary character set (which is the same
2627  as no particular character set), and is never
2628  converted to any other character set. See also
2629  notes about supplying string/blob length
2630  below.
2631  MYSQL_TYPE_NULL special typecode for binding nulls.
2632  These C/C++ types are not supported yet by the API: long double,
2633  bool.
2634 
2635  As you can see from the list above, it's responsibility of
2636  application programmer to ensure that chosen typecode properly
2637  corresponds to host language type. For example on all platforms
2638  where we build MySQL packages (as of MySQL 4.1.4) int is a 32-bit
2639  type. So for int you can always assume that proper typecode is
2640  MYSQL_TYPE_LONG (however queer it sounds, the name is legacy of the
2641  old MySQL API). In contrary sizeof(long) can be 4 or 8 8-bit bytes,
2642  depending on platform.
2643 
2644  TODO: provide client typedefs for each integer and floating point
2645  typecode, i. e. int8, uint8, float32, etc.
2646 
2647  Once typecode was set, it's necessary to assign MYSQL_BIND::buffer
2648  to point to the buffer of given type. Finally, additional actions
2649  may be taken for some types or use cases:
2650 
2651  Binding integer types.
2652  For integer types you might also need to set MYSQL_BIND::is_unsigned
2653  member. Set it to TRUE when binding unsigned char, unsigned short,
2654  unsigned int, unsigned long, unsigned long long.
2655 
2656  Binding floating point types.
2657  For floating point types you just need to set
2658  MYSQL_BIND::buffer_type and MYSQL_BIND::buffer. The rest of the
2659  members should be zero-initialized.
2660 
2661  Binding NULLs.
2662  You might have a column always NULL, never NULL, or sometimes
2663  NULL. For an always NULL column set MYSQL_BIND::buffer_type to
2664  MYSQL_TYPE_NULL. The rest of the members just need to be
2665  zero-initialized. For never NULL columns set
2666  MYSQL_BIND::is_null to 0, or this has already been done if you
2667  zero-initialized the entire structure. If you set
2668  MYSQL_TYPE::is_null to point to an application buffer of type
2669  'my_bool', then this buffer will be checked on each execution:
2670  this way you can set the buffer to TRUE, or any non-0 value for
2671  NULLs, and to FALSE or 0 for not NULL data.
2672 
2673  Binding text strings and sequences of bytes.
2674  For strings, in addition to MYSQL_BIND::buffer_type and
2675  MYSQL_BIND::buffer you need to set MYSQL_BIND::length or
2676  MYSQL_BIND::buffer_length. If 'length' is set, 'buffer_length'
2677  is ignored. 'buffer_length' member should be used when size of
2678  string doesn't change between executions. If you want to vary
2679  buffer length for each value, set 'length' to point to an
2680  application buffer of type 'unsigned long' and set this long to
2681  length of the string before each mysql_stmt_execute().
2682 
2683  Binding dates and times.
2684  For binding dates and times prepared statements API provides
2685  clients with MYSQL_TIME structure. A pointer to instance of this
2686  structure should be assigned to MYSQL_BIND::buffer whenever
2687  MYSQL_TYPE_TIME, MYSQL_TYPE_DATE, MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME typecodes
2688  are used. When typecode is MYSQL_TYPE_TIME, only members
2689  'hour', 'minute', 'second' and 'neg' (is time offset negative)
2690  are used. These members only will be sent to the server.
2691  MYSQL_TYPE_DATE implies use of 'year', 'month', 'day', 'neg'.
2692  MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME utilizes both parts of MYSQL_TIME structure.
2693  You don't have to set MYSQL_TIME::time_type member: it's not
2694  used when sending data to the server, typecode information is
2695  enough. 'second_part' member can hold microsecond precision of
2696  time value, but now it's only supported on protocol level: you
2697  can't store microsecond in a column, or use in temporal
2698  calculations. However, if you send a time value with microsecond
2699  part for 'SELECT ?', statement, you'll get it back unchanged
2700  from the server.
2701 
2702  Data conversion.
2703  If conversion from host language type to data representation,
2704  corresponding to SQL type, is required it's done on the server.
2705  Data truncation is possible when conversion is lossy. For
2706  example, if you supply MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME value out of valid
2707  SQL type TIMESTAMP range, the same conversion will be applied as
2708  if this value would have been sent as string in the old
2709  protocol. TODO: document how the server will behave in case of
2710  truncation/data loss.
2711 
2712  After variables were bound, you can repeatedly set/change their
2713  values and mysql_stmt_execute() the statement.
2714 
2715  See also: mysql_stmt_send_long_data() for sending long text/blob
2716  data in pieces, examples in tests/mysql_client_test.c.
2717  Next steps you might want to make:
2718  - execute statement with mysql_stmt_execute(),
2719  - reset statement using mysql_stmt_reset() or reprepare it with
2720  another query using mysql_stmt_prepare()
2721  - close statement with mysql_stmt_close().
2722 
2723  IMPLEMENTATION
2724  The function copies given bind array to internal storage of the
2725  statement, and sets up typecode-specific handlers to perform
2726  serialization of bound data. This means that although you don't need
2727  to call this routine after each assignment to bind buffers, you
2728  need to call it each time you change parameter typecodes, or other
2729  members of MYSQL_BIND array.
2730  This is a pure local call. Data types of client buffers are sent
2731  along with buffers' data at first execution of the statement.
2732 
2733  RETURN
2734  0 success
2735  1 error, can be retrieved with mysql_stmt_error.
2736 */
2737 
2738 my_bool STDCALL mysql_stmt_bind_param(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, MYSQL_BIND *my_bind)
2739 {
2740  uint count=0;
2741  MYSQL_BIND *param, *end;
2742  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_bind_param");
2743 
2744  if (!stmt->param_count)
2745  {
2746  if ((int) stmt->state < (int) MYSQL_STMT_PREPARE_DONE)
2747  {
2748  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_NO_PREPARE_STMT, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
2749  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2750  }
2751  DBUG_RETURN(0);
2752  }
2753 
2754  /* Allocated on prepare */
2755  memcpy((char*) stmt->params, (char*) my_bind,
2756  sizeof(MYSQL_BIND) * stmt->param_count);
2757 
2758  for (param= stmt->params, end= param+stmt->param_count;
2759  param < end ;
2760  param++)
2761  {
2762  param->param_number= count++;
2763  param->long_data_used= 0;
2764 
2765  /* If param->is_null is not set, then the value can never be NULL */
2766  if (!param->is_null)
2767  param->is_null= &int_is_null_false;
2768 
2769  /* Setup data copy functions for the different supported types */
2770  switch (param->buffer_type) {
2771  case MYSQL_TYPE_NULL:
2772  param->is_null= &int_is_null_true;
2773  break;
2774  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY:
2775  /* Force param->length as this is fixed for this type */
2776  param->length= &param->buffer_length;
2777  param->buffer_length= 1;
2778  param->store_param_func= store_param_tinyint;
2779  break;
2780  case MYSQL_TYPE_SHORT:
2781  param->length= &param->buffer_length;
2782  param->buffer_length= 2;
2783  param->store_param_func= store_param_short;
2784  break;
2785  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG:
2786  param->length= &param->buffer_length;
2787  param->buffer_length= 4;
2788  param->store_param_func= store_param_int32;
2789  break;
2790  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG:
2791  param->length= &param->buffer_length;
2792  param->buffer_length= 8;
2793  param->store_param_func= store_param_int64;
2794  break;
2795  case MYSQL_TYPE_FLOAT:
2796  param->length= &param->buffer_length;
2797  param->buffer_length= 4;
2798  param->store_param_func= store_param_float;
2799  break;
2800  case MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE:
2801  param->length= &param->buffer_length;
2802  param->buffer_length= 8;
2803  param->store_param_func= store_param_double;
2804  break;
2805  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIME:
2806  param->store_param_func= store_param_time;
2807  param->buffer_length= MAX_TIME_REP_LENGTH;
2808  break;
2809  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATE:
2810  param->store_param_func= store_param_date;
2811  param->buffer_length= MAX_DATE_REP_LENGTH;
2812  break;
2813  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME:
2814  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
2815  param->store_param_func= store_param_datetime;
2816  param->buffer_length= MAX_DATETIME_REP_LENGTH;
2817  break;
2818  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY_BLOB:
2819  case MYSQL_TYPE_MEDIUM_BLOB:
2820  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG_BLOB:
2821  case MYSQL_TYPE_BLOB:
2822  case MYSQL_TYPE_VARCHAR:
2823  case MYSQL_TYPE_VAR_STRING:
2824  case MYSQL_TYPE_STRING:
2825  case MYSQL_TYPE_DECIMAL:
2826  case MYSQL_TYPE_NEWDECIMAL:
2827  param->store_param_func= store_param_str;
2828  /*
2829  For variable length types user must set either length or
2830  buffer_length.
2831  */
2832  break;
2833  default:
2834  strmov(stmt->sqlstate, unknown_sqlstate);
2835  sprintf(stmt->last_error,
2836  ER(stmt->last_errno= CR_UNSUPPORTED_PARAM_TYPE),
2837  param->buffer_type, count);
2838  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2839  }
2840  /*
2841  If param->length is not given, change it to point to buffer_length.
2842  This way we can always use *param->length to get the length of data
2843  */
2844  if (!param->length)
2845  param->length= &param->buffer_length;
2846  }
2847  /* We have to send/resend type information to MySQL */
2848  stmt->send_types_to_server= TRUE;
2849  stmt->bind_param_done= TRUE;
2850  DBUG_RETURN(0);
2851 }
2852 
2853 
2854 /********************************************************************
2855  Long data implementation
2856 *********************************************************************/
2857 
2858 /*
2859  Send long data in pieces to the server
2860 
2861  SYNOPSIS
2862  mysql_stmt_send_long_data()
2863  stmt Statement handler
2864  param_number Parameter number (0 - N-1)
2865  data Data to send to server
2866  length Length of data to send (may be 0)
2867 
2868  DESCRIPTION
2869  This call can be used repeatedly to send long data in pieces
2870  for any string/binary placeholder. Data supplied for
2871  a placeholder is saved at server side till execute, and then
2872  used instead of value from MYSQL_BIND object. More precisely,
2873  if long data for a parameter was supplied, MYSQL_BIND object
2874  corresponding to this parameter is not sent to server. In the
2875  end of execution long data states of placeholders are reset,
2876  so next time values of such placeholders will be taken again
2877  from MYSQL_BIND array.
2878  The server does not reply to this call: if there was an error
2879  in data handling (which now only can happen if server run out
2880  of memory) it would be returned in reply to
2881  mysql_stmt_execute().
2882  You should choose type of long data carefully if you care
2883  about character set conversions performed by server when the
2884  statement is executed. No conversion is performed at all for
2885  MYSQL_TYPE_BLOB and other binary typecodes. For
2886  MYSQL_TYPE_STRING and the rest of text placeholders data is
2887  converted from client character set to character set of
2888  connection. If these character sets are different, this
2889  conversion may require additional memory at server, equal to
2890  total size of supplied pieces.
2891 
2892  RETURN VALUES
2893  0 ok
2894  1 error
2895 */
2896 
2897 my_bool STDCALL
2898 mysql_stmt_send_long_data(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, uint param_number,
2899  const char *data, ulong length)
2900 {
2901  MYSQL_BIND *param;
2902  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_send_long_data");
2903  DBUG_ASSERT(stmt != 0);
2904  DBUG_PRINT("enter",("param no: %d data: 0x%lx, length : %ld",
2905  param_number, (long) data, length));
2906 
2907  /*
2908  We only need to check for stmt->param_count, if it's not null
2909  prepare was done.
2910  */
2911  if (param_number >= stmt->param_count)
2912  {
2913  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_INVALID_PARAMETER_NO, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
2914  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2915  }
2916 
2917  param= stmt->params+param_number;
2918  if (!IS_LONGDATA(param->buffer_type))
2919  {
2920  /* Long data handling should be used only for string/binary types */
2921  strmov(stmt->sqlstate, unknown_sqlstate);
2922  sprintf(stmt->last_error, ER(stmt->last_errno= CR_INVALID_BUFFER_USE),
2923  param->param_number);
2924  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2925  }
2926 
2927  /*
2928  Send long data packet if there is data or we're sending long data
2929  for the first time.
2930  */
2931  if (length || param->long_data_used == 0)
2932  {
2933  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
2934  /* Packet header: stmt id (4 bytes), param no (2 bytes) */
2935  uchar buff[MYSQL_LONG_DATA_HEADER];
2936 
2937  int4store(buff, stmt->stmt_id);
2938  int2store(buff + 4, param_number);
2939  param->long_data_used= 1;
2940 
2941  /*
2942  Note that we don't get any ok packet from the server in this case
2943  This is intentional to save bandwidth.
2944  */
2945  if ((*mysql->methods->advanced_command)(mysql, COM_STMT_SEND_LONG_DATA,
2946  buff, sizeof(buff), (uchar*) data,
2947  length, 1, stmt))
2948  {
2949  /*
2950  Don't set stmt error if stmt->mysql is NULL, as the error in this case
2951  has already been set by mysql_prune_stmt_list().
2952  */
2953  if (stmt->mysql)
2954  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, &mysql->net);
2955  DBUG_RETURN(1);
2956  }
2957  }
2958  DBUG_RETURN(0);
2959 }
2960
