2962 /********************************************************************
2963  Fetch and conversion of result set rows (binary protocol).
2964 *********************************************************************/
2965 
2966 /*
2967  Read date, (time, datetime) value from network buffer and store it
2968  in MYSQL_TIME structure.
2969 
2970  SYNOPSIS
2971  read_binary_{date,time,datetime}()
2972  tm MYSQL_TIME structure to fill
2973  pos pointer to current position in network buffer.
2974  These functions increase pos to point to the beginning of the
2975  next column.
2976 
2977  Auxiliary functions to read time (date, datetime) values from network
2978  buffer and store in MYSQL_TIME structure. Jointly used by conversion
2979  and no-conversion fetching.
2980 */
2981 
2982 static void read_binary_time(MYSQL_TIME *tm, uchar **pos)
2983 {
2984  /* net_field_length will set pos to the first byte of data */
2985  uint length= net_field_length(pos);
2986 
2987  if (length)
2988  {
2989  uchar *to= *pos;
2990  tm->neg= to[0];
2991 
2992  tm->day= (ulong) sint4korr(to+1);
2993  tm->hour= (uint) to[5];
2994  tm->minute= (uint) to[6];
2995  tm->second= (uint) to[7];
2996  tm->second_part= (length > 8) ? (ulong) sint4korr(to+8) : 0;
2997  tm->year= tm->month= 0;
2998  if (tm->day)
2999  {
3000  /* Convert days to hours at once */
3001  tm->hour+= tm->day*24;
3002  tm->day= 0;
3003  }
3004  tm->time_type= MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_TIME;
3005 
3006  *pos+= length;
3007  }
3008  else
3009  set_zero_time(tm, MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_TIME);
3010 }
3011 
3012 static void read_binary_datetime(MYSQL_TIME *tm, uchar **pos)
3013 {
3014  uint length= net_field_length(pos);
3015 
3016  if (length)
3017  {
3018  uchar *to= *pos;
3019 
3020  tm->neg= 0;
3021  tm->year= (uint) sint2korr(to);
3022  tm->month= (uint) to[2];
3023  tm->day= (uint) to[3];
3024 
3025  if (length > 4)
3026  {
3027  tm->hour= (uint) to[4];
3028  tm->minute= (uint) to[5];
3029  tm->second= (uint) to[6];
3030  }
3031  else
3032  tm->hour= tm->minute= tm->second= 0;
3033  tm->second_part= (length > 7) ? (ulong) sint4korr(to+7) : 0;
3034  tm->time_type= MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_DATETIME;
3035 
3036  *pos+= length;
3037  }
3038  else
3039  set_zero_time(tm, MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_DATETIME);
3040 }
3041 
3042 static void read_binary_date(MYSQL_TIME *tm, uchar **pos)
3043 {
3044  uint length= net_field_length(pos);
3045 
3046  if (length)
3047  {
3048  uchar *to= *pos;
3049  tm->year = (uint) sint2korr(to);
3050  tm->month= (uint) to[2];
3051  tm->day= (uint) to[3];
3052 
3053  tm->hour= tm->minute= tm->second= 0;
3054  tm->second_part= 0;
3055  tm->neg= 0;
3056  tm->time_type= MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_DATE;
3057 
3058  *pos+= length;
3059  }
3060  else
3061  set_zero_time(tm, MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_DATE);
3062 }

3065 /*
3066  Convert string to supplied buffer of any type.
3067 
3068  SYNOPSIS
3069  fetch_string_with_conversion()
3070  param output buffer descriptor
3071  value column data
3072  length data length
3073 */
3074 
3075 static void fetch_string_with_conversion(MYSQL_BIND *param, char *value,
3076  uint length)
3077 {
3078  char *buffer= (char *)param->buffer;
3079  int err= 0;
3080  char *endptr= value + length;
3081 
3082  /*
3083  This function should support all target buffer types: the rest
3084  of conversion functions can delegate conversion to it.
3085  */
3086  switch (param->buffer_type) {
3087  case MYSQL_TYPE_NULL: /* do nothing */
3088  break;
3089  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY:
3090  {
3091  longlong data= my_strtoll10(value, &endptr, &err);
3092  *param->error= (IS_TRUNCATED(data, param->is_unsigned,
3093  INT_MIN8, INT_MAX8, UINT_MAX8) || err > 0);
3094  *buffer= (uchar) data;
3095  break;
3096  }
3097  case MYSQL_TYPE_SHORT:
3098  {
3099  longlong data= my_strtoll10(value, &endptr, &err);
3100  *param->error= (IS_TRUNCATED(data, param->is_unsigned,
3101  INT_MIN16, INT_MAX16, UINT_MAX16) || err > 0);
3102  shortstore(buffer, (short) data);
3103  break;
3104  }
3105  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG:
3106  {
3107  longlong data= my_strtoll10(value, &endptr, &err);
3108  *param->error= (IS_TRUNCATED(data, param->is_unsigned,
3109  INT_MIN32, INT_MAX32, UINT_MAX32) || err > 0);
3110  longstore(buffer, (int32) data);
3111  break;
3112  }
3113  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG:
3114  {
3115  longlong data= my_strtoll10(value, &endptr, &err);
3116  *param->error= param->is_unsigned ? err != 0 :
3117  (err > 0 || (err == 0 && data < 0));
3118  longlongstore(buffer, data);
3119  break;
3120  }
3121  case MYSQL_TYPE_FLOAT:
3122  {
3123  double data= my_strntod(&my_charset_latin1, value, length, &endptr, &err);
3124  float fdata= (float) data;
3125  *param->error= (fdata != data) | test(err);
3126  floatstore(buffer, fdata);
3127  break;
3128  }
3129  case MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE:
3130  {
3131  double data= my_strntod(&my_charset_latin1, value, length, &endptr, &err);
3132  *param->error= test(err);
3133  doublestore(buffer, data);
3134  break;
3135  }
3136  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIME:
3137  {
3138  MYSQL_TIME *tm= (MYSQL_TIME *)buffer;
3139  str_to_time(value, length, tm, &err);
3140  *param->error= test(err);
3141  break;
3142  }
3143  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATE:
3144  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME:
3145  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
3146  {
3147  MYSQL_TIME *tm= (MYSQL_TIME *)buffer;
3148  (void) str_to_datetime(value, length, tm, TIME_FUZZY_DATE, &err);
3149  *param->error= test(err) && (param->buffer_type == MYSQL_TYPE_DATE &&
3150  tm->time_type != MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_DATE);
3151  break;
3152  }
3153  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY_BLOB:
3154  case MYSQL_TYPE_MEDIUM_BLOB:
3155  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG_BLOB:
3156  case MYSQL_TYPE_BLOB:
3157  case MYSQL_TYPE_DECIMAL:
3158  case MYSQL_TYPE_NEWDECIMAL:
3159  default:
3160  {
3161  /*
3162  Copy column data to the buffer taking into account offset,
3163  data length and buffer length.
3164  */
3165  char *start= value + param->offset;
3166  char *end= value + length;
3167  ulong copy_length;
3168  if (start < end)
3169  {
3170  copy_length= end - start;
3171  /* We've got some data beyond offset: copy up to buffer_length bytes */
3172  if (param->buffer_length)
3173  memcpy(buffer, start, min(copy_length, param->buffer_length));
3174  }
3175  else
3176  copy_length= 0;
3177  if (copy_length < param->buffer_length)
3178  buffer[copy_length]= '\0';
3179  *param->error= copy_length > param->buffer_length;
3180  /*
3181  param->length will always contain length of entire column;
3182  number of copied bytes may be way different:
3183  */
3184  *param->length= length;
3185  break;
3186  }
3187  }
3188 }
3189 
3190 
3191 /*
3192  Convert integer value to client buffer of any type.
3193 
3194  SYNOPSIS
3195  fetch_long_with_conversion()
3196  param output buffer descriptor
3197  field column metadata
3198  value column data
3199 */
3200 
3201 static void fetch_long_with_conversion(MYSQL_BIND *param, MYSQL_FIELD *field,
3202  longlong value, my_bool is_unsigned)
3203 {
3204  char *buffer= (char *)param->buffer;
3205 
3206  switch (param->buffer_type) {
3207  case MYSQL_TYPE_NULL: /* do nothing */
3208  break;
3209  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY:
3210  *param->error= IS_TRUNCATED(value, param->is_unsigned,
3211  INT_MIN8, INT_MAX8, UINT_MAX8);
3212  *(uchar *)param->buffer= (uchar) value;
3213  break;
3214  case MYSQL_TYPE_SHORT:
3215  *param->error= IS_TRUNCATED(value, param->is_unsigned,
3216  INT_MIN16, INT_MAX16, UINT_MAX16);
3217  shortstore(buffer, (short) value);
3218  break;
3219  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG:
3220  *param->error= IS_TRUNCATED(value, param->is_unsigned,
3221  INT_MIN32, INT_MAX32, UINT_MAX32);
3222  longstore(buffer, (int32) value);
3223  break;
3224  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG:
3225  longlongstore(buffer, value);
3226  *param->error= param->is_unsigned != is_unsigned && value < 0;
3227  break;
3228  case MYSQL_TYPE_FLOAT:
3229  {
3230  /*
3231  We need to mark the local variable volatile to
3232  workaround Intel FPU executive precision feature.
3233  (See http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=323 for details)
3234  */
3235  volatile float data;
3236  if (is_unsigned)
3237  {
3238  data= (float) ulonglong2double(value);
3239  *param->error= ((ulonglong) value) != ((ulonglong) data);
3240  }
3241  else
3242  {
3243  data= (float)value;
3244  *param->error= value != ((longlong) data);
3245  }
3246  floatstore(buffer, data);
3247  break;
3248  }
3249  case MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE:
3250  {
3251  volatile double data;
3252  if (is_unsigned)
3253  {
3254  data= ulonglong2double(value);
3255  *param->error= ((ulonglong) value) != ((ulonglong) data);
3256  }
3257  else
3258  {
3259  data= (double)value;
3260  *param->error= value != ((longlong) data);
3261  }
3262  doublestore(buffer, data);
3263  break;
3264  }
3265  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIME:
3266  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATE:
3267  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
3268  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME:
3269  {
3270  int error;
3271  value= number_to_datetime(value, (MYSQL_TIME *) buffer, TIME_FUZZY_DATE,
3272  &error);
3273  *param->error= test(error);
3274  break;
3275  }
3276  default:
3277  {
3278  uchar buff[22]; /* Enough for longlong */
3279  uchar *end= (uchar*) longlong10_to_str(value, (char*) buff,
3280  is_unsigned ? 10: -10);
3281  /* Resort to string conversion which supports all typecodes */
3282  uint length= (uint) (end-buff);
3283 
3284  if (field->flags & ZEROFILL_FLAG && length < field->length &&
3285  field->length < 21)
3286  {
3287  bmove_upp(buff+field->length,buff+length, length);
3288  bfill(buff, field->length - length,'0');
3289  length= field->length;
3290  }
3291  fetch_string_with_conversion(param, (char*) buff, length);
3292  break;
3293  }
3294  }
3295 }
3296 
3297 /*
3298  Convert double/float column to supplied buffer of any type.
3299 
3300  SYNOPSIS
3301  fetch_float_with_conversion()
3302  param output buffer descriptor
3303  field column metadata
3304  value column data
3305  type either MY_GCVT_ARG_FLOAT or MY_GCVT_ARG_DOUBLE.
3306  Affects the maximum number of significant digits
3307  returned by my_gcvt().
3308 */
3309 
3310 static void fetch_float_with_conversion(MYSQL_BIND *param, MYSQL_FIELD *field,
3311  double value, my_gcvt_arg_type type)
3312 {
3313  char *buffer= (char *)param->buffer;
3314  double val64 = (value < 0 ? -floor(-value) : floor(value));
3315 
3316  switch (param->buffer_type) {
3317  case MYSQL_TYPE_NULL: /* do nothing */
3318  break;
3319  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY:
3320  /*
3321  We need to _store_ data in the buffer before the truncation check to
3322  workaround Intel FPU executive precision feature.
3323  (See http://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=323 for details)
3324  Sic: AFAIU it does not guarantee to work.
3325  */
3326  if (param->is_unsigned)
3327  *buffer= (uint8) value;
3328  else
3329  *buffer= (int8) value;
3330  *param->error= val64 != (param->is_unsigned ? (double)((uint8) *buffer) :
3331  (double)((int8) *buffer));
3332  break;
3333  case MYSQL_TYPE_SHORT:
3334  if (param->is_unsigned)
3335  {
3336  ushort data= (ushort) value;
3337  shortstore(buffer, data);
3338  }
3339  else
3340  {
3341  short data= (short) value;
3342  shortstore(buffer, data);
3343  }
3344  *param->error= val64 != (param->is_unsigned ? (double) (*(ushort*) buffer):
3345  (double) (*(short*) buffer));
3346  break;
3347  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG:
3348  if (param->is_unsigned)
3349  {
3350  uint32 data= (uint32) value;
3351  longstore(buffer, data);
3352  }
3353  else
3354  {
3355  int32 data= (int32) value;
3356  longstore(buffer, data);
3357  }
3358  *param->error= val64 != (param->is_unsigned ? (double) (*(uint32*) buffer):
3359  (double) (*(int32*) buffer));
3360  break;
3361  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG:
3362  if (param->is_unsigned)
3363  {
3364  ulonglong data= (ulonglong) value;
3365  longlongstore(buffer, data);
3366  }
3367  else
3368  {
3369  longlong data= (longlong) value;
3370  longlongstore(buffer, data);
3371  }
3372  *param->error= val64 != (param->is_unsigned ?
3373  ulonglong2double(*(ulonglong*) buffer) :
3374  (double) (*(longlong*) buffer));
3375  break;
3376  case MYSQL_TYPE_FLOAT:
3377  {
3378  float data= (float) value;
3379  floatstore(buffer, data);
3380  *param->error= (*(float*) buffer) != value;
3381  break;
3382  }
3383  case MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE:
3384  {
3385  doublestore(buffer, value);
3386  break;
3387  }
3388  default:
3389  {
3390  /*
3391  Resort to fetch_string_with_conversion: this should handle
3392  floating point -> string conversion nicely, honor all typecodes
3393  and param->offset possibly set in mysql_stmt_fetch_column
3394  */
3395  char buff[FLOATING_POINT_BUFFER];
3396  size_t len;
3397  if (field->decimals >= NOT_FIXED_DEC)
3398  len= my_gcvt(value, type,
3399  (int) min(sizeof(buff)-1, param->buffer_length),
3400  buff, NULL);
3401  else
3402  len= my_fcvt(value, (int) field->decimals, buff, NULL);
3403 
3404  if (field->flags & ZEROFILL_FLAG && len < field->length &&
3405  field->length < MAX_DOUBLE_STRING_REP_LENGTH - 1)
3406  {
3407  bmove_upp((uchar*) buff + field->length, (uchar*) buff + len,
3408  len);
3409  bfill((char*) buff, field->length - len, '0');
3410  len= field->length;
3411  }
3412  fetch_string_with_conversion(param, buff, len);
3413 
3414  break;
3415  }
3416  }
3417 }
3418 
3419 
3420 /*
3421  Fetch time/date/datetime to supplied buffer of any type
3422 
3423  SYNOPSIS
3424  param output buffer descriptor
3425  time column data
3426 */
3427 
3428 static void fetch_datetime_with_conversion(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3429  MYSQL_FIELD *field,
3430  MYSQL_TIME *my_time)
3431 {
3432  switch (param->buffer_type) {
3433  case MYSQL_TYPE_NULL: /* do nothing */
3434  break;
3435  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATE:
3436  *(MYSQL_TIME *)(param->buffer)= *my_time;
3437  *param->error= my_time->time_type != MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_DATE;
3438  break;
3439  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIME:
3440  *(MYSQL_TIME *)(param->buffer)= *my_time;
3441  *param->error= my_time->time_type != MYSQL_TIMESTAMP_TIME;
3442  break;
3443  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME:
3444  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
3445  *(MYSQL_TIME *)(param->buffer)= *my_time;
3446  /* No error: time and date are compatible with datetime */
3447  break;
3448  case MYSQL_TYPE_YEAR:
3449  shortstore(param->buffer, my_time->year);
3450  *param->error= 1;
3451  break;
3452  case MYSQL_TYPE_FLOAT:
3453  case MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE:
3454  {
3455  ulonglong value= TIME_to_ulonglong(my_time);
3456  fetch_float_with_conversion(param, field,
3457  ulonglong2double(value), MY_GCVT_ARG_DOUBLE);
3458  break;
3459  }
3460  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY:
3461  case MYSQL_TYPE_SHORT:
3462  case MYSQL_TYPE_INT24:
3463  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG:
3464  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG:
3465  {
3466  longlong value= (longlong) TIME_to_ulonglong(my_time);
3467  fetch_long_with_conversion(param, field, value, TRUE);
3468  break;
3469  }
3470  default:
3471  {
3472  /*
3473  Convert time value to string and delegate the rest to
3474  fetch_string_with_conversion:
3475  */
3476  char buff[MAX_DATE_STRING_REP_LENGTH];
3477  uint length= my_TIME_to_str(my_time, buff);
3478  /* Resort to string conversion */
3479  fetch_string_with_conversion(param, (char *)buff, length);
3480  break;
3481  }
3482  }
3483 }
3484 
3485 
3486 /*
3487  Fetch and convert result set column to output buffer.
3488 
3489  SYNOPSIS
3490  fetch_result_with_conversion()
3491  param output buffer descriptor
3492  field column metadata
3493  row points to a column of result set tuple in binary format
3494 
3495  DESCRIPTION
3496  This is a fallback implementation of column fetch used
3497  if column and output buffer types do not match.
3498  Increases tuple pointer to point at the next column within the
3499  tuple.
3500 */
3501 
3502 static void fetch_result_with_conversion(MYSQL_BIND *param, MYSQL_FIELD *field,
3503  uchar **row)
3504 {
3505  enum enum_field_types field_type= field->type;
3506  uint field_is_unsigned= field->flags & UNSIGNED_FLAG;
3507 
3508  switch (field_type) {
3509  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY:
3510  {
3511  uchar value= **row;
3512  /* sic: we need to cast to 'signed char' as 'char' may be unsigned */
3513  longlong data= field_is_unsigned ? (longlong) value :
3514  (longlong) (signed char) value;
3515  fetch_long_with_conversion(param, field, data, 0);
3516  *row+= 1;
3517  break;
3518  }
3519  case MYSQL_TYPE_SHORT:
3520  case MYSQL_TYPE_YEAR:
3521  {
3522  short value= sint2korr(*row);
3523  longlong data= field_is_unsigned ? (longlong) (unsigned short) value :
3524  (longlong) value;
3525  fetch_long_with_conversion(param, field, data, 0);
3526  *row+= 2;
3527  break;
3528  }
3529  case MYSQL_TYPE_INT24: /* mediumint is sent as 4 bytes int */
3530  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG:
3531  {
3532  int32 value= sint4korr(*row);
3533  longlong data= field_is_unsigned ? (longlong) (uint32) value :
3534  (longlong) value;
3535  fetch_long_with_conversion(param, field, data, 0);
3536  *row+= 4;
3537  break;
3538  }
3539  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG:
3540  {
3541  longlong value= (longlong)sint8korr(*row);
3542  fetch_long_with_conversion(param, field, value,
3543  field->flags & UNSIGNED_FLAG);
3544  *row+= 8;
3545  break;
3546  }
3547  case MYSQL_TYPE_FLOAT:
3548  {
3549  float value;
3550  float4get(value,*row);
3551  fetch_float_with_conversion(param, field, value, MY_GCVT_ARG_FLOAT);
3552  *row+= 4;
3553  break;
3554  }
3555  case MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE:
3556  {
3557  double value;
3558  float8get(value,*row);
3559  fetch_float_with_conversion(param, field, value, MY_GCVT_ARG_DOUBLE);
3560  *row+= 8;
3561  break;
3562  }
3563  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATE:
3564  {
3565  MYSQL_TIME tm;
3566 
3567  read_binary_date(&tm, row);
3568  fetch_datetime_with_conversion(param, field, &tm);
3569  break;
3570  }
3571  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIME:
3572  {
3573  MYSQL_TIME tm;
3574 
3575  read_binary_time(&tm, row);
3576  fetch_datetime_with_conversion(param, field, &tm);
3577  break;
3578  }
3579  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME:
3580  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
3581  {
3582  MYSQL_TIME tm;
3583 
3584  read_binary_datetime(&tm, row);
3585  fetch_datetime_with_conversion(param, field, &tm);
3586  break;
3587  }
3588  default:
3589  {
3590  ulong length= net_field_length(row);
3591  fetch_string_with_conversion(param, (char*) *row, length);
3592  *row+= length;
3593  break;
3594  }
3595  }
3596 }
3597 
3598 
3599 /*
3600  Functions to fetch data to application buffers without conversion.
3601 
3602  All functions have the following characteristics:
3603 
3604  SYNOPSIS
3605  fetch_result_xxx()
3606  param MySQL bind param
3607  pos Row value
3608 
3609  DESCRIPTION
3610  These are no-conversion functions, used in binary protocol to store
3611  rows in application buffers. A function used only if type of binary data
3612  is compatible with type of application buffer.
3613 
3614  RETURN
3615  none
3616 */
3617 
3618 static void fetch_result_tinyint(MYSQL_BIND *param, MYSQL_FIELD *field,
3619  uchar **row)
3620 {
3621  my_bool field_is_unsigned= test(field->flags & UNSIGNED_FLAG);
3622  uchar data= **row;
3623  *(uchar *)param->buffer= data;
3624  *param->error= param->is_unsigned != field_is_unsigned && data > INT_MAX8;
3625  (*row)++;
3626 }
3627 
3628 static void fetch_result_short(MYSQL_BIND *param, MYSQL_FIELD *field,
3629  uchar **row)
3630 {
3631  my_bool field_is_unsigned= test(field->flags & UNSIGNED_FLAG);
3632  ushort data= (ushort) sint2korr(*row);
3633  shortstore(param->buffer, data);
3634  *param->error= param->is_unsigned != field_is_unsigned && data > INT_MAX16;
3635  *row+= 2;
3636 }
3637 
3638 static void fetch_result_int32(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3639  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3640  uchar **row)
3641 {
3642  my_bool field_is_unsigned= test(field->flags & UNSIGNED_FLAG);
3643  uint32 data= (uint32) sint4korr(*row);
3644  longstore(param->buffer, data);
3645  *param->error= param->is_unsigned != field_is_unsigned && data > INT_MAX32;
3646  *row+= 4;
3647 }
3648 
3649 static void fetch_result_int64(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3650  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3651  uchar **row)
3652 {
3653  my_bool field_is_unsigned= test(field->flags & UNSIGNED_FLAG);
3654  ulonglong data= (ulonglong) sint8korr(*row);
3655  *param->error= param->is_unsigned != field_is_unsigned && data > LONGLONG_MAX;
3656  longlongstore(param->buffer, data);
3657  *row+= 8;
3658 }
3659 
3660 static void fetch_result_float(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3661  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3662  uchar **row)
3663 {
3664  float value;
3665  float4get(value,*row);
3666  floatstore(param->buffer, value);
3667  *row+= 4;
3668 }
3669 
3670 static void fetch_result_double(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3671  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3672  uchar **row)
3673 {
3674  double value;
3675  float8get(value,*row);
3676  doublestore(param->buffer, value);
3677  *row+= 8;
3678 }
3679 
3680 static void fetch_result_time(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3681  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3682  uchar **row)
3683 {
3684  MYSQL_TIME *tm= (MYSQL_TIME *)param->buffer;
3685  read_binary_time(tm, row);
3686 }
3687 
3688 static void fetch_result_date(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3689  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3690  uchar **row)
3691 {
3692  MYSQL_TIME *tm= (MYSQL_TIME *)param->buffer;
3693  read_binary_date(tm, row);
3694 }
3695 
3696 static void fetch_result_datetime(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3697  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3698  uchar **row)
3699 {
3700  MYSQL_TIME *tm= (MYSQL_TIME *)param->buffer;
3701  read_binary_datetime(tm, row);
3702 }
3703 
3704 static void fetch_result_bin(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3705  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3706  uchar **row)
3707 {
3708  ulong length= net_field_length(row);
3709  ulong copy_length= min(length, param->buffer_length);
3710  memcpy(param->buffer, (char *)*row, copy_length);
3711  *param->length= length;
3712  *param->error= copy_length < length;
3713  *row+= length;
3714 }
3715 
3716 static void fetch_result_str(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3717  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3718  uchar **row)
3719 {
3720  ulong length= net_field_length(row);
3721  ulong copy_length= min(length, param->buffer_length);
3722  memcpy(param->buffer, (char *)*row, copy_length);
3723  /* Add an end null if there is room in the buffer */
3724  if (copy_length != param->buffer_length)
3725  ((uchar *)param->buffer)[copy_length]= '\0';
3726  *param->length= length; /* return total length */
3727  *param->error= copy_length < length;
3728  *row+= length;
3729 }
3730 
3731 
3732 /*
3733  functions to calculate max lengths for strings during
3734  mysql_stmt_store_result()
3735 */
3736 
3737 static void skip_result_fixed(MYSQL_BIND *param,
3738  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3739  uchar **row)
3740 
3741 {
3742  (*row)+= param->pack_length;
3743 }
3744 
3745 
3746 static void skip_result_with_length(MYSQL_BIND *param __attribute__((unused)),
3747  MYSQL_FIELD *field __attribute__((unused)),
3748  uchar **row)
3749 
3750 {
3751  ulong length= net_field_length(row);
3752  (*row)+= length;
3753 }
3754 
3755 
3756 static void skip_result_string(MYSQL_BIND *param __attribute__((unused)),
3757  MYSQL_FIELD *field,
3758  uchar **row)
3759 
3760 {
3761  ulong length= net_field_length(row);
3762  (*row)+= length;
3763  if (field->max_length < length)
3764  field->max_length= length;
3765 }
3766 
3767 
3768 /*
3769  Check that two field types are binary compatible i. e.
3770  have equal representation in the binary protocol and
3771  require client-side buffers of the same type.
3772 
3773  SYNOPSIS
3774  is_binary_compatible()
3775  type1 parameter type supplied by user
3776  type2 field type, obtained from result set metadata
3777 
3778  RETURN
3779  TRUE or FALSE
3780 */
3781 
3782 static my_bool is_binary_compatible(enum enum_field_types type1,
3783  enum enum_field_types type2)
3784 {
3785  static const enum enum_field_types
3786  range1[]= { MYSQL_TYPE_SHORT, MYSQL_TYPE_YEAR, MYSQL_TYPE_NULL },
3787  range2[]= { MYSQL_TYPE_INT24, MYSQL_TYPE_LONG, MYSQL_TYPE_NULL },
3788  range3[]= { MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME, MYSQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP, MYSQL_TYPE_NULL },
3789  range4[]= { MYSQL_TYPE_ENUM, MYSQL_TYPE_SET, MYSQL_TYPE_TINY_BLOB,
3790  MYSQL_TYPE_MEDIUM_BLOB, MYSQL_TYPE_LONG_BLOB, MYSQL_TYPE_BLOB,
3791  MYSQL_TYPE_VAR_STRING, MYSQL_TYPE_STRING, MYSQL_TYPE_GEOMETRY,
3792  MYSQL_TYPE_DECIMAL, MYSQL_TYPE_NULL };
3793  static const enum enum_field_types
3794  *range_list[]= { range1, range2, range3, range4 },
3795  **range_list_end= range_list + sizeof(range_list)/sizeof(*range_list);
3796  const enum enum_field_types **range, *type;
3797 
3798  if (type1 == type2)
3799  return TRUE;
3800  for (range= range_list; range != range_list_end; ++range)
3801  {
3802  /* check that both type1 and type2 are in the same range */
3803  my_bool type1_found= FALSE, type2_found= FALSE;
3804  for (type= *range; *type != MYSQL_TYPE_NULL; type++)
3805  {
3806  type1_found|= type1 == *type;
3807  type2_found|= type2 == *type;
3808  }
3809  if (type1_found || type2_found)
3810  return type1_found && type2_found;
3811  }
3812  return FALSE;
3813 }
3814 
3815 
3816 /*
3817  Setup a fetch function for one column of a result set.
3818 
3819  SYNOPSIS
3820  setup_one_fetch_function()
3821  param output buffer descriptor
3822  field column descriptor
3823 
3824  DESCRIPTION
3825  When user binds result set buffers or when result set
3826  metadata is changed, we need to setup fetch (and possibly
3827  conversion) functions for all columns of the result set.
3828  In addition to that here we set up skip_result function, used
3829  to update result set metadata in case when
3830  STMT_ATTR_UPDATE_MAX_LENGTH attribute is set.
3831  Notice that while fetch_result is chosen depending on both
3832  field->type and param->type, skip_result depends on field->type
3833  only.
3834 
3835  RETURN
3836  TRUE fetch function for this typecode was not found (typecode
3837  is not supported by the client library)
3838  FALSE success
3839 */
3840 
3841 static my_bool setup_one_fetch_function(MYSQL_BIND *param, MYSQL_FIELD *field)
3842 {
3843  DBUG_ENTER("setup_one_fetch_function");
3844 
3845  /* Setup data copy functions for the different supported types */
3846  switch (param->buffer_type) {
3847  case MYSQL_TYPE_NULL: /* for dummy binds */
3848  /*
3849  It's not binary compatible with anything the server can return:
3850  no need to setup fetch_result, as it'll be reset anyway
3851  */
3852  *param->length= 0;
3853  break;
3854  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY:
3855  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_tinyint;
3856  *param->length= 1;
3857  break;
3858  case MYSQL_TYPE_SHORT:
3859  case MYSQL_TYPE_YEAR:
3860  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_short;
3861  *param->length= 2;
3862  break;
3863  case MYSQL_TYPE_INT24:
3864  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG:
3865  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_int32;
3866  *param->length= 4;
3867  break;
3868  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG:
3869  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_int64;
3870  *param->length= 8;
3871  break;
3872  case MYSQL_TYPE_FLOAT:
3873  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_float;
3874  *param->length= 4;
3875  break;
3876  case MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE:
3877  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_double;
3878  *param->length= 8;
3879  break;
3880  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIME:
3881  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_time;
3882  *param->length= sizeof(MYSQL_TIME);
3883  break;
3884  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATE:
3885  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_date;
3886  *param->length= sizeof(MYSQL_TIME);
3887  break;
3888  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME:
3889  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
3890  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_datetime;
3891  *param->length= sizeof(MYSQL_TIME);
3892  break;
3893  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY_BLOB:
3894  case MYSQL_TYPE_MEDIUM_BLOB:
3895  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG_BLOB:
3896  case MYSQL_TYPE_BLOB:
3897  case MYSQL_TYPE_BIT:
3898  DBUG_ASSERT(param->buffer_length != 0);
3899  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_bin;
3900  break;
3901  case MYSQL_TYPE_VAR_STRING:
3902  case MYSQL_TYPE_STRING:
3903  case MYSQL_TYPE_DECIMAL:
3904  case MYSQL_TYPE_NEWDECIMAL:
3905  case MYSQL_TYPE_NEWDATE:
3906  DBUG_ASSERT(param->buffer_length != 0);
3907  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_str;
3908  break;
3909  default:
3910  DBUG_PRINT("error", ("Unknown param->buffer_type: %u",
3911  (uint) param->buffer_type));
3912  DBUG_RETURN(TRUE);
3913  }
3914  if (! is_binary_compatible(param->buffer_type, field->type))
3915  param->fetch_result= fetch_result_with_conversion;
3916 
3917  /* Setup skip_result functions (to calculate max_length) */
3918  param->skip_result= skip_result_fixed;
3919  switch (field->type) {
3920  case MYSQL_TYPE_NULL: /* for dummy binds */
3921  param->pack_length= 0;
3922  field->max_length= 0;
3923  break;
3924  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY:
3925  param->pack_length= 1;
3926  field->max_length= 4; /* as in '-127' */
3927  break;
3928  case MYSQL_TYPE_YEAR:
3929  case MYSQL_TYPE_SHORT:
3930  param->pack_length= 2;
3931  field->max_length= 6; /* as in '-32767' */
3932  break;
3933  case MYSQL_TYPE_INT24:
3934  field->max_length= 9; /* as in '16777216' or in '-8388607' */
3935  param->pack_length= 4;
3936  break;
3937  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG:
3938  field->max_length= 11; /* '-2147483647' */
3939  param->pack_length= 4;
3940  break;
3941  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONGLONG:
3942  field->max_length= 21; /* '18446744073709551616' */
3943  param->pack_length= 8;
3944  break;
3945  case MYSQL_TYPE_FLOAT:
3946  param->pack_length= 4;
3947  field->max_length= MAX_DOUBLE_STRING_REP_LENGTH;
3948  break;
3949  case MYSQL_TYPE_DOUBLE:
3950  param->pack_length= 8;
3951  field->max_length= MAX_DOUBLE_STRING_REP_LENGTH;
3952  break;
3953  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIME:
3954  field->max_length= 15; /* 19:23:48.123456 */
3955  param->skip_result= skip_result_with_length;
3956  break;
3957  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATE:
3958  field->max_length= 10; /* 2003-11-11 */
3959  param->skip_result= skip_result_with_length;
3960  break;
3961  case MYSQL_TYPE_DATETIME:
3962  case MYSQL_TYPE_TIMESTAMP:
3963  param->skip_result= skip_result_with_length;
3964  field->max_length= MAX_DATE_STRING_REP_LENGTH;
3965  break;
3966  case MYSQL_TYPE_DECIMAL:
3967  case MYSQL_TYPE_NEWDECIMAL:
3968  case MYSQL_TYPE_ENUM:
3969  case MYSQL_TYPE_SET:
3970  case MYSQL_TYPE_GEOMETRY:
3971  case MYSQL_TYPE_TINY_BLOB:
3972  case MYSQL_TYPE_MEDIUM_BLOB:
3973  case MYSQL_TYPE_LONG_BLOB:
3974  case MYSQL_TYPE_BLOB:
3975  case MYSQL_TYPE_VAR_STRING:
3976  case MYSQL_TYPE_STRING:
3977  case MYSQL_TYPE_BIT:
3978  case MYSQL_TYPE_NEWDATE:
3979  param->skip_result= skip_result_string;
3980  break;
3981  default:
3982  DBUG_PRINT("error", ("Unknown field->type: %u", (uint) field->type));
3983  DBUG_RETURN(TRUE);
3984  }
3985  DBUG_RETURN(FALSE);
3986 }
3987 
3988 
3989 /*
3990  Setup the bind buffers for resultset processing
3991 */
3992 
3993 my_bool STDCALL mysql_stmt_bind_result(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, MYSQL_BIND *my_bind)
3994 {
3995  MYSQL_BIND *param, *end;
3996  MYSQL_FIELD *field;
3997  ulong bind_count= stmt->field_count;
3998  uint param_count= 0;
3999  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_bind_result");
4000  DBUG_PRINT("enter",("field_count: %lu", bind_count));
4001 
4002  if (!bind_count)
4003  {
4004  int errorcode= (int) stmt->state < (int) MYSQL_STMT_PREPARE_DONE ?
4005  CR_NO_PREPARE_STMT : CR_NO_STMT_METADATA;
4006  set_stmt_error(stmt, errorcode, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
4007  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4008  }
4009 
4010  /*
4011  We only need to check that stmt->field_count - if it is not null
4012  stmt->bind was initialized in mysql_stmt_prepare
4013  stmt->bind overlaps with bind if mysql_stmt_bind_param
4014  is called from mysql_stmt_store_result.
4015  */
4016 
4017  if (stmt->bind != my_bind)
4018  memcpy((char*) stmt->bind, (char*) my_bind,
4019  sizeof(MYSQL_BIND) * bind_count);
4020 
4021  for (param= stmt->bind, end= param + bind_count, field= stmt->fields ;
4022  param < end ;
4023  param++, field++)
4024  {
4025  DBUG_PRINT("info",("buffer_type: %u field_type: %u",
4026  (uint) param->buffer_type, (uint) field->type));
4027  /*
4028  Set param->is_null to point to a dummy variable if it's not set.
4029  This is to make the execute code easier
4030  */
4031  if (!param->is_null)
4032  param->is_null= &param->is_null_value;
4033 
4034  if (!param->length)
4035  param->length= &param->length_value;
4036 
4037  if (!param->error)
4038  param->error= &param->error_value;
4039 
4040  param->param_number= param_count++;
4041  param->offset= 0;
4042 
4043  if (setup_one_fetch_function(param, field))
4044  {
4045  strmov(stmt->sqlstate, unknown_sqlstate);
4046  sprintf(stmt->last_error,
4047  ER(stmt->last_errno= CR_UNSUPPORTED_PARAM_TYPE),
4048  field->type, param_count);
4049  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4050  }
4051  }
4052  stmt->bind_result_done= BIND_RESULT_DONE;
4053  if (stmt->mysql->options.report_data_truncation)
4054  stmt->bind_result_done|= REPORT_DATA_TRUNCATION;
4055 
4056  DBUG_RETURN(0);
4057 }
4058 
4059 
4060 /*
4061  Fetch row data to bind buffers
4062 */
4063 
4064 static int stmt_fetch_row(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, uchar *row)
4065 {
4066  MYSQL_BIND *my_bind, *end;
4067  MYSQL_FIELD *field;
4068  uchar *null_ptr, bit;
4069  int truncation_count= 0;
4070  /*
4071  Precondition: if stmt->field_count is zero or row is NULL, read_row_*
4072  function must return no data.
4073  */
4074  DBUG_ASSERT(stmt->field_count);
4075  DBUG_ASSERT(row);
4076 
4077  if (!stmt->bind_result_done)
4078  {
4079  /* If output parameters were not bound we should just return success */
4080  return 0;
4081  }
4082 
4083  null_ptr= row;
4084  row+= (stmt->field_count+9)/8; /* skip null bits */
4085  bit= 4; /* first 2 bits are reserved */
4086 
4087  /* Copy complete row to application buffers */
4088  for (my_bind= stmt->bind, end= my_bind + stmt->field_count,
4089  field= stmt->fields ;
4090  my_bind < end ;
4091  my_bind++, field++)
4092  {
4093  *my_bind->error= 0;
4094  if (*null_ptr & bit)
4095  {
4096  /*
4097  We should set both row_ptr and is_null to be able to see
4098  nulls in mysql_stmt_fetch_column. This is because is_null may point
4099  to user data which can be overwritten between mysql_stmt_fetch and
4100  mysql_stmt_fetch_column, and in this case nullness of column will be
4101  lost. See mysql_stmt_fetch_column for details.
4102  */
4103  my_bind->row_ptr= NULL;
4104  *my_bind->is_null= 1;
4105  }
4106  else
4107  {
4108  *my_bind->is_null= 0;
4109  my_bind->row_ptr= row;
4110  (*my_bind->fetch_result)(my_bind, field, &row);
4111  truncation_count+= *my_bind->error;
4112  }
4113  if (!((bit<<=1) & 255))
4114  {
4115  bit= 1; /* To next uchar */
4116  null_ptr++;
4117  }
4118  }
4119  if (truncation_count && (stmt->bind_result_done & REPORT_DATA_TRUNCATION))
4120  return MYSQL_DATA_TRUNCATED;
4121  return 0;
4122 }
4123 
4124 
4125 int cli_unbuffered_fetch(MYSQL *mysql, char **row)
4126 {
4127  if (packet_error == cli_safe_read(mysql))
4128  return 1;
4129 
4130  *row= ((mysql->net.read_pos[0] == 254) ? NULL :
4131  (char*) (mysql->net.read_pos+1));
4132  return 0;
4133 }
4134 
4135 
4136 /*
4137  Fetch and return row data to bound buffers, if any
4138 */
4139 
4140 int STDCALL mysql_stmt_fetch(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
4141 {
4142  int rc;
4143  uchar *row;
4144  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_fetch");
4145 
4146  if ((rc= (*stmt->read_row_func)(stmt, &row)) ||
4147  ((rc= stmt_fetch_row(stmt, row)) && rc != MYSQL_DATA_TRUNCATED))
4148  {
4149  stmt->state= MYSQL_STMT_PREPARE_DONE; /* XXX: this is buggy */
4150  stmt->read_row_func= (rc == MYSQL_NO_DATA) ?
4151  stmt_read_row_no_data : stmt_read_row_no_result_set;
4152  }
4153  else
4154  {
4155  /* This is to know in mysql_stmt_fetch_column that data was fetched */
4156  stmt->state= MYSQL_STMT_FETCH_DONE;
4157  }
4158  DBUG_RETURN(rc);
4159 }
4160 
4161 
4162 /*
4163  Fetch data for one specified column data
4164 
4165  SYNOPSIS
4166  mysql_stmt_fetch_column()
4167  stmt Prepared statement handler
4168  my_bind Where data should be placed. Should be filled in as
4169  when calling mysql_stmt_bind_result()
4170  column Column to fetch (first column is 0)
4171  ulong offset Offset in result data (to fetch blob in pieces)
4172  This is normally 0
4173  RETURN
4174  0 ok
4175  1 error
4176 */
4177 
4178 int STDCALL mysql_stmt_fetch_column(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, MYSQL_BIND *my_bind,
4179  uint column, ulong offset)
4180 {
4181  MYSQL_BIND *param= stmt->bind+column;
4182  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_fetch_column");
4183 
4184  if ((int) stmt->state < (int) MYSQL_STMT_FETCH_DONE)
4185  {
4186  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_NO_DATA, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
4187  return 1;
4188  }
4189  if (column >= stmt->field_count)
4190  {
4191  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_INVALID_PARAMETER_NO, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
4192  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4193  }
4194 
4195  if (!my_bind->error)
4196  my_bind->error= &my_bind->error_value;
4197  *my_bind->error= 0;
4198  if (param->row_ptr)
4199  {
4200  MYSQL_FIELD *field= stmt->fields+column;
4201  uchar *row= param->row_ptr;
4202  my_bind->offset= offset;
4203  if (my_bind->is_null)
4204  *my_bind->is_null= 0;
4205  if (my_bind->length) /* Set the length if non char/binary types */
4206  *my_bind->length= *param->length;
4207  else
4208  my_bind->length= &param->length_value; /* Needed for fetch_result() */
4209  fetch_result_with_conversion(my_bind, field, &row);
4210  }
4211  else
4212  {
4213  if (my_bind->is_null)
4214  *my_bind->is_null= 1;
4215  }
4216  DBUG_RETURN(0);
4217 }
4218 
4219 
4220 /*
4221  Read all rows of data from server (binary format)
4222 */
4223 
4224 int cli_read_binary_rows(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
4225 {
4226  ulong pkt_len;
4227  uchar *cp;
4228  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
4229  MYSQL_DATA *result= &stmt->result;
4230  MYSQL_ROWS *cur, **prev_ptr= &result->data;
4231  NET *net;
4232 
4233  DBUG_ENTER("cli_read_binary_rows");
4234 
4235  if (!mysql)
4236  {
4237  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_SERVER_LOST, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
4238  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4239  }
4240 
4241  net = &mysql->net;
4242 
4243  while ((pkt_len= cli_safe_read(mysql)) != packet_error)
4244  {
4245  cp= net->read_pos;
4246  if (cp[0] != 254 || pkt_len >= 8)
4247  {
4248  if (!(cur= (MYSQL_ROWS*) alloc_root(&result->alloc,
4249  sizeof(MYSQL_ROWS) + pkt_len - 1)))
4250  {
4251  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_OUT_OF_MEMORY, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
4252  goto err;
4253  }
4254  cur->data= (MYSQL_ROW) (cur+1);
4255  *prev_ptr= cur;
4256  prev_ptr= &cur->next;
4257  memcpy((char *) cur->data, (char *) cp+1, pkt_len-1);
4258  cur->length= pkt_len; /* To allow us to do sanity checks */
4259  result->rows++;
4260  }
4261  else
4262  {
4263  /* end of data */
4264  *prev_ptr= 0;
4265  mysql->warning_count= uint2korr(cp+1);
4266  mysql->server_status= uint2korr(cp+3);
4267  DBUG_PRINT("info",("status: %u warning_count: %u",
4268  mysql->server_status, mysql->warning_count));
4269  DBUG_RETURN(0);
4270  }
4271  }
4272  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, net);
4273 
4274 err:
4275  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4276 }
4277 
4278 
4279 /*
4280  Update meta data for statement
4281 
4282  SYNOPSIS
4283  stmt_update_metadata()
4284  stmt Statement handler
4285  row Binary data
4286 
4287  NOTES
4288  Only updates MYSQL_FIELD->max_length for strings
4289 */
4290 
4291 static void stmt_update_metadata(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, MYSQL_ROWS *data)
4292 {
4293  MYSQL_BIND *my_bind, *end;
4294  MYSQL_FIELD *field;
4295  uchar *null_ptr, bit;
4296  uchar *row= (uchar*) data->data;
4297 #ifndef DBUG_OFF
4298  uchar *row_end= row + data->length;
4299 #endif
4300 
4301  null_ptr= row;
4302  row+= (stmt->field_count+9)/8; /* skip null bits */
4303  bit= 4; /* first 2 bits are reserved */
4304 
4305  /* Go through all fields and calculate metadata */
4306  for (my_bind= stmt->bind, end= my_bind + stmt->field_count, field= stmt->fields ;
4307  my_bind < end ;
4308  my_bind++, field++)
4309  {
4310  if (!(*null_ptr & bit))
4311  (*my_bind->skip_result)(my_bind, field, &row);
4312  DBUG_ASSERT(row <= row_end);
4313  if (!((bit<<=1) & 255))
4314  {
4315  bit= 1; /* To next uchar */
4316  null_ptr++;
4317  }
4318  }
4319 }
4320 
4321 
4322 /*
4323  Store or buffer the binary results to stmt
4324 */
4325 
4326 int STDCALL mysql_stmt_store_result(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
4327 {
4328  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
4329  MYSQL_DATA *result= &stmt->result;
4330  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_store_result");
4331 
4332  if (!mysql)
4333  {
4334  /* mysql can be reset in mysql_close called from mysql_reconnect */
4335  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_SERVER_LOST, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
4336  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4337  }
4338 
4339  if (!stmt->field_count)
4340  DBUG_RETURN(0);
4341 
4342  if ((int) stmt->state < (int) MYSQL_STMT_EXECUTE_DONE)
4343  {
4344  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_COMMANDS_OUT_OF_SYNC, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
4345  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4346  }
4347 
4348  if (stmt->last_errno)
4349  {
4350  /* An attempt to use an invalid statement handle. */
4351  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4352  }
4353 
4354  if (mysql->status == MYSQL_STATUS_READY &&
4355  stmt->server_status & SERVER_STATUS_CURSOR_EXISTS)
4356  {
4357  /*
4358  Server side cursor exist, tell server to start sending the rows
4359  */
4360  NET *net= &mysql->net;
4361  uchar buff[4 /* statement id */ +
4362  4 /* number of rows to fetch */];
4363 
4364  /* Send row request to the server */
4365  int4store(buff, stmt->stmt_id);
4366  int4store(buff + 4, (int)~0); /* number of rows to fetch */
4367  if (cli_advanced_command(mysql, COM_STMT_FETCH, buff, sizeof(buff),
4368  (uchar*) 0, 0, 1, stmt))
4369  {
4370  /*
4371  Don't set stmt error if stmt->mysql is NULL, as the error in this case
4372  has already been set by mysql_prune_stmt_list().
4373  */
4374  if (stmt->mysql)
4375  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, net);
4376  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4377  }
4378  }
4379  else if (mysql->status != MYSQL_STATUS_STATEMENT_GET_RESULT)
4380  {
4381  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_COMMANDS_OUT_OF_SYNC, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
4382  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4383  }
4384 
4385  if (stmt->update_max_length && !stmt->bind_result_done)
4386  {
4387  /*
4388  We must initalize the bind structure to be able to calculate
4389  max_length
4390  */
4391  MYSQL_BIND *my_bind, *end;
4392  MYSQL_FIELD *field;
4393  bzero((char*) stmt->bind, sizeof(*stmt->bind)* stmt->field_count);
4394 
4395  for (my_bind= stmt->bind, end= my_bind + stmt->field_count,
4396  field= stmt->fields;
4397  my_bind < end ;
4398  my_bind++, field++)
4399  {
4400  my_bind->buffer_type= MYSQL_TYPE_NULL;
4401  my_bind->buffer_length=1;
4402  }
4403 
4404  if (mysql_stmt_bind_result(stmt, stmt->bind))
4405  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4406  stmt->bind_result_done= 0; /* No normal bind done */
4407  }
4408 
4409  if ((*mysql->methods->read_binary_rows)(stmt))
4410  {
4411  free_root(&result->alloc, MYF(MY_KEEP_PREALLOC));
4412  result->data= NULL;
4413  result->rows= 0;
4414  mysql->status= MYSQL_STATUS_READY;
4415  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4416  }
4417 
4418  /* Assert that if there was a cursor, all rows have been fetched */
4419  DBUG_ASSERT(mysql->status != MYSQL_STATUS_READY ||
4420  (mysql->server_status & SERVER_STATUS_LAST_ROW_SENT));
4421 
4422  if (stmt->update_max_length)
4423  {
4424  MYSQL_ROWS *cur= result->data;
4425  for(; cur; cur=cur->next)
4426  stmt_update_metadata(stmt, cur);
4427  }
4428 
4429  stmt->data_cursor= result->data;
4430  mysql->affected_rows= stmt->affected_rows= result->rows;
4431  stmt->read_row_func= stmt_read_row_buffered;
4432  mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner= 0; /* set in stmt_execute */
4433  mysql->status= MYSQL_STATUS_READY; /* server is ready */
4434  DBUG_RETURN(0); /* Data buffered, must be fetched with mysql_stmt_fetch() */
4435 }

4466 /*

4468 */
4469 
4470 void STDCALL
4471 mysql_stmt_data_seek(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, my_ulonglong row)
4472 {

4476

4478  ;

4480  if (!row && tmp)
4481  {
4482  /* Rewind the counter */
4483  stmt->read_row_func= stmt_read_row_buffered;

4500 
4501 
4502 /*
4503  Free the client side memory buffers, reset long data state
4504  on client if necessary, and reset the server side statement if
4505  this has been requested.
4506 */
4507 
4508 static my_bool reset_stmt_handle(MYSQL_STMT *stmt, uint flags)
4509 {
4510  /* If statement hasn't been prepared there is nothing to reset */
4511  if ((int) stmt->state > (int) MYSQL_STMT_INIT_DONE)
4512  {
4513  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
4514  MYSQL_DATA *result= &stmt->result;
4515 
4516  /*
4517  Reset stored result set if so was requested or it's a part
4518  of cursor fetch.
4519  */
4520  if (flags & RESET_STORE_RESULT)
4521  {
4522  /* Result buffered */
4523  free_root(&result->alloc, MYF(MY_KEEP_PREALLOC));
4524  result->data= NULL;
4525  result->rows= 0;
4526  stmt->data_cursor= NULL;
4527  }
4528  if (flags & RESET_LONG_DATA)
4529  {
4530  MYSQL_BIND *param= stmt->params, *param_end= param + stmt->param_count;
4531  /* Clear long_data_used flags */
4532  for (; param < param_end; param++)
4533  param->long_data_used= 0;
4534  }
4535  stmt->read_row_func= stmt_read_row_no_result_set;
4536  if (mysql)
4537  {
4538  if ((int) stmt->state > (int) MYSQL_STMT_PREPARE_DONE)
4539  {
4540  if (mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner == &stmt->unbuffered_fetch_cancelled)
4541  mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner= 0;
4542  if (stmt->field_count && mysql->status != MYSQL_STATUS_READY)
4543  {
4544  /* There is a result set and it belongs to this statement */
4545  (*mysql->methods->flush_use_result)(mysql, FALSE);
4546  if (mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner)
4547  *mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner= TRUE;
4548  mysql->status= MYSQL_STATUS_READY;
4549  }
4550  }
4551  if (flags & RESET_SERVER_SIDE)
4552  {
4553  /*
4554  Reset the server side statement and close the server side
4555  cursor if it exists.
4556  */
4557  uchar buff[MYSQL_STMT_HEADER]; /* packet header: 4 bytes for stmt id */
4558  int4store(buff, stmt->stmt_id);
4559  if ((*mysql->methods->advanced_command)(mysql, COM_STMT_RESET, buff,
4560  sizeof(buff), 0, 0, 0, stmt))
4561  {
4562  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, &mysql->net);
4563  stmt->state= MYSQL_STMT_INIT_DONE;
4564  return 1;
4565  }
4566  }
4567  }
4568  if (flags & RESET_CLEAR_ERROR)
4569  stmt_clear_error(stmt);
4570  stmt->state= MYSQL_STMT_PREPARE_DONE;
4571  }
4572  return 0;
4573 }
4574 
4575 my_bool STDCALL mysql_stmt_free_result(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
4576 {
4577  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_free_result");
4578 
4579  /* Free the client side and close the server side cursor if there is one */
4580  DBUG_RETURN(reset_stmt_handle(stmt, RESET_LONG_DATA | RESET_STORE_RESULT |
4581  RESET_CLEAR_ERROR));
4582 }
4583 
4584 /********************************************************************
4585  statement error handling and close
4586 *********************************************************************/
4587 
4588 /*
4589  Close the statement handle by freeing all alloced resources
4590 
4591  SYNOPSIS
4592  mysql_stmt_close()
4593  stmt Statement handle
4594 
4595  RETURN VALUES
4596  0 ok
4597  1 error
4598 */
4599 
4600 my_bool STDCALL mysql_stmt_close(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
4601 {
4602  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
4603  int rc= 0;
4604  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_close");
4605 
4606  free_root(&stmt->result.alloc, MYF(0));
4607  free_root(&stmt->mem_root, MYF(0));
4608 
4609  if (mysql)
4610  {
4611  mysql->stmts= list_delete(mysql->stmts, &stmt->list);
4612  /*
4613  Clear NET error state: if the following commands come through
4614  successfully, connection will still be usable for other commands.
4615  */
4616  net_clear_error(&mysql->net);
4617  if ((int) stmt->state > (int) MYSQL_STMT_INIT_DONE)
4618  {
4619  uchar buff[MYSQL_STMT_HEADER]; /* 4 bytes - stmt id */
4620 
4621  if (mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner == &stmt->unbuffered_fetch_cancelled)
4622  mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner= 0;
4623  if (mysql->status != MYSQL_STATUS_READY)
4624  {
4625  /*
4626  Flush result set of the connection. If it does not belong
4627  to this statement, set a warning.
4628  */
4629  (*mysql->methods->flush_use_result)(mysql, TRUE);
4630  if (mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner)
4631  *mysql->unbuffered_fetch_owner= TRUE;
4632  mysql->status= MYSQL_STATUS_READY;
4633  }
4634  int4store(buff, stmt->stmt_id);
4635  if ((rc= stmt_command(mysql, COM_STMT_CLOSE, buff, 4, stmt)))
4636  {
4637  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, &mysql->net);
4638  }
4639  }
4640  }
4641 
4642  my_free(stmt);
4643 
4644  DBUG_RETURN(test(rc));
4645 }
4646 
4647 /*
4648  Reset the statement buffers in server
4649 */
4650 
4651 my_bool STDCALL mysql_stmt_reset(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
4652 {
4653  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_reset");
4654  DBUG_ASSERT(stmt != 0);
4655  if (!stmt->mysql)
4656  {
4657  /* mysql can be reset in mysql_close called from mysql_reconnect */
4658  set_stmt_error(stmt, CR_SERVER_LOST, unknown_sqlstate, NULL);
4659  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4660  }
4661  /* Reset the client and server sides of the prepared statement */
4662  DBUG_RETURN(reset_stmt_handle(stmt,
4663  RESET_SERVER_SIDE | RESET_LONG_DATA |
4664  RESET_CLEAR_ERROR));
4665 }

4734 /********************************************************************
4735  Multi query execution + SPs APIs
4736 *********************************************************************/
4737 
4738 /*
4739  Returns true/false to indicate whether any more query results exist
4740  to be read using mysql_next_result()
4741 */
4742 
4743 my_bool STDCALL mysql_more_results(MYSQL *mysql)
4744 {
4745  my_bool res;
4746  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_more_results");
4747 
4748  res= ((mysql->server_status & SERVER_MORE_RESULTS_EXISTS) ? 1: 0);
4749  DBUG_PRINT("exit",("More results exists ? %d", res));
4750  DBUG_RETURN(res);
4751 }
4752 
4753 
4754 /*
4755  Reads and returns the next query results
4756 */
4757 int STDCALL mysql_next_result(MYSQL *mysql)
4758 {
4759  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_next_result");
4760 
4761  if (mysql->status != MYSQL_STATUS_READY)
4762  {
4763  set_mysql_error(mysql, CR_COMMANDS_OUT_OF_SYNC, unknown_sqlstate);
4764  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4765  }
4766 
4767  net_clear_error(&mysql->net);
4768  mysql->affected_rows= ~(my_ulonglong) 0;
4769 
4770  if (mysql->server_status & SERVER_MORE_RESULTS_EXISTS)
4771  DBUG_RETURN((*mysql->methods->next_result)(mysql));
4772 
4773  DBUG_RETURN(-1); /* No more results */
4774 }
4775 
4776 
4777 int STDCALL mysql_stmt_next_result(MYSQL_STMT *stmt)
4778 {
4779  MYSQL *mysql= stmt->mysql;
4780  int rc;
4781  DBUG_ENTER("mysql_stmt_next_result");
4782 
4783  if (!mysql)
4784  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4785 
4786  if (stmt->last_errno)
4787  DBUG_RETURN(stmt->last_errno);
4788 
4789  if (mysql->server_status & SERVER_MORE_RESULTS_EXISTS)
4790  {
4791  if (reset_stmt_handle(stmt, RESET_STORE_RESULT))
4792  DBUG_RETURN(1);
4793  }
4794 
4795  rc= mysql_next_result(mysql);
4796 
4797  if (rc)
4798  {
4799  set_stmt_errmsg(stmt, &mysql->net);
4800  DBUG_RETURN(rc);
4801  }
4802 
4803  if (mysql->status == MYSQL_STATUS_GET_RESULT)
4804  mysql->status= MYSQL_STATUS_STATEMENT_GET_RESULT;
4805 
4806  stmt->state= MYSQL_STMT_EXECUTE_DONE;
4807  stmt->bind_result_done= FALSE;
4808 
4809  if (mysql->field_count)
4810  {
4811  alloc_stmt_fields(stmt);
4812  prepare_to_fetch_result(stmt);
4813  }
4814  else
4815  {
4816  stmt->field_count= mysql->field_count;
4817  }
4818 
4819  DBUG_RETURN(0);
4820 }
4821

4826 }
